In addition, I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious everything was. I was expecting some sort of poutine for the manimal fries, but it was a rather tasty and gooey sauce slathered over the thick-cut fries. Also really loved how the ricecakes were soft on the inside, yet crispy on the outside even with all the sauce over it. I hear their menu changes often, so hopefully can get a chance to try these items!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Innovative cocktails with swoon-worthy themed menus to match. In the past, for example, these menus have taken the form of Pantone color charts or zodiac wheels, and have gotten such an outsized reputation that they're often stolen by customers as collectors' items. 

Alas, the decidedly un-diverse crowd here can get quite douchey, pushy, and entitled, especially when it comes to hogging the limited amount of seats and space at ground level. Moreover, non-white customers can count on getting passed over at the bar in favor of white customers who are out of turn or, worse yet, being addressed in an outright hostile manner from certain blonde female bartenders. 

Fortunately, for a more civilized experience, there's an upstairs dining room where the service is far better, where you can get the same food and drink as downstairs, and where you don't have to be pushed around or be the subject of death stares for looking out of place. The food offerings are quite good and reasonably priced given their quality, whether the scotch egg or the eponymous "trick dog."

Go for the upstairs experience and avoid the entitled, self-absorbed West Bay crowd downstairs.
author: Vincent L.

description: Great atmosphere and great cocktails if you can get to the bar. This place gets really crowded during happy hour. It's a great place to come back to because they change their menu every month with a whole new design and custom cocktails. The small plates are pretty tasty.
author: Marco J.

description: Loud and crowded on weekends. Not sure about weeknights. Great themed cocktails and fun changing menu. I got the Glasgow and then got outta there
author: Christine K.

description: Very cool bar kind of tucked away in a neighborhood.  Small and packed when I was there but had no trouble with getting served.  Cool decor.  Eclectic music playing.  A little industrial look to the place  interesting drink menu.   Not too expensive for SF.  Definitely would go again
author: Kevin K.

description: Hi, can someone reach out to me. I was double charged for my food bill last Wednesday night. I found out when I checked my bank statement. I tried calling the number you provided on yelp but no one picked up. I can give you my direct number if you direct message me on Facebook/instagram. My name is Francis Barte. Thanks
author: Francis B.

description:
Awesome cocktail bar in the city serving super cool mixology drinks!
Definitely loved the vibe in this bar, and the menu they had offering the various drinks.. these were so unique and boy, was I intrigued! 

I went for the "vogue" cocktail, and my friends got a cocktail with banana and lime, and one of the wine cocktails...all of them were delicious, and reasonably priced for unique cocktail drinks in SF ($10+).

They've even got beer and a shot, beer cocktails, and high baller cocktails ($50+)! I didn't get to see if they had bar bites, but I'd definitely come back to check for some/try their other drinks!
author: Mary F.

description:
After a few failed attempts to try Trick Dog, I finally was able to make it happen last night! It helped that we got there before 5pm and was a smaller group. 

We opted to share the Pina Colada that is served in a pineapple! It is a very well balanced drink, not too sweet, good boozy kick, mellowed out by the green tea and pineapple juice. Also was able to try the Moon Landing and Reptilian Elite drink. The Mood Landing drink looked like the moon and reminded me of a modern interpretation of a martini. As for the reptilian, it was a very refreshing drink. 

The novelty of the rotating menu themes is compelling and truly a unique presentation that I can see why it keeps people coming back.

I would like to come back to have dinner in their upstairs area.

Overall Thoughts

I would return back to Trick Dog but I would not be willing to wait hours to do so
author: Eddie W.

description:
Let's start with the facts: I'm not cool enough to drink here.

I don't like enough variety and experimentation in the drinks I drink* when I have the chance to go out (toddlers and newborns at home make it tough to get out late) to really take advantage of all the variety and experimentation going on at the bar downstairs.

The menus change to reflect the seasons, and to incorporate local SF culture. All drinks are meticulously made, even when the crowd swells to three or four deep at the bar.***

I am, however, cool enough to eat the food upstairs, and you can't go wrong with just about anything on the menu. On my recent visit, they had things such as tempura-fried avocado, banana leaf shrimp dumplings, and the thrice-cooked fries, which were super crispy and I believe a fairly evergreen item.

Your experience here will depend on your level of aversion to plaid, skinny-jeans-ness, and similar cool-determining factors but if you just like good cocktails, or adventurous food, you'll find something that will make you feel cool.****

* - Just give me a Buffalo Trace Old Fashioned for the rest of my life and I will certainly enjoy my time drinking with me and my 85-year-old lady friends on the Upper East Side.**

** - True story: once ordered and old fashioned at a bar and bartender says, "what, are you an 85-year-old grandma on the Upper East Side?" because apparently they're the only ones who drink them. Whatever. It's not fruit cocktail bullshit, it's delicious.

*** - Get here early if you want a drink. By 7:30 or 8 there's so many folks that it's hard to sit or even stand, for the most part.

**** - At least while you're there.
author: Danny P.

description:
Have you ever watched "Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory"? If so, that's great because Trick Dog is as close as you can get in terms of it being an adults and instead of chocolate you're being served great drinks! 

If my intro hasn't gotten you hooked then I don't know what will because this is "The Place" to go to when you are having a "ruff" day (Get it? Because the name of the place is Trick Dog, ha!). While I'm sitting at home laughing at my own lame joke, you could be taking this time and trying it out yourself. There are plenty of selections to choose from so it is almost impossible to leave thirsty, UNLESS you're a party-pooper than I would understand why you hesitated on showing up.
author: Benson M.

description: I went to this place with another friend of mine while we are here for business. We were looking forward to explore different part of town and get nice cocktails. We order couple cocktails each, I think tell you this is the best cocktail bar in America I have been to. This place serve dinner as well, we had their chicken nuggets, yes I know such a fat ass but they were worth it. We balanced our meal with the kale salad, oh my gay! If i could make such a salad, I would eat kale every day!
author: Naoufel T.

description: Great service, awesome atmosphere, and phenomenal cocktails. Recommend coming on a weekday to stay away from the tech crowds!
author: Anthony N.

description:
Trick Dog has a super fun, revolving menu of drinks, and all of them are always very unique, strong, and excellent. 

Also shout out to the biggest and best kale salad you can ever get in a bar and to the trick dog, a delicious, unique burger that is shaped like a hot dog.
author: Christina S.

description: This is a fun bar.  A tongue in cheek menu of artisanal drinks. Very attractive bartenders and wait staff. Hip, young crowd. Interesting looking lighting fixtures.
author: Anne V.

description:
I think it's about time I write a review about this place since I frequent it so often. 

This is my neighborhood watering hole. I live conveniently 3 blocks from here aka drunk walking home distance. So shhhh keep it on the DL I like it on the emptier side ;) 

But in all seriousness this is a great joint and def check it out! I know most of the bartenders by name - they hired a few new females which is great - but my favorite guy by far is MARK! 

Mark is THE MAN. He makes quite possibly the best drinks in all of SF (I also like Chambers and Bourbon & Branch) and I always start with the Greg Galinsky. It's my all time favorite drink in SF and I've probably ordered 10 of them at least because it's just that good! Gin, herbally, citrusy, and not to sweet or tart. It's my kinda first cocktail of the night. (Erm and sometimes all my cocktails for the night especially if Mark is making them!!)

Mark can make you anything your heart desires, be you man or woman or any [person]man, as in he can customize any of the drinks or he can even do a bartender's choice kinda cocktail. He's also very sweet and pours generously ;) I feel a little bad but when Mark's behind the bar I wait for Mark and only tip Mark...sorry I'm a loyal drinker. 

Finally, their drink menu changes quarterly (I think) and they partner with local nonprofits. SO RAD. Right now they're partnering with Precita Eyes (down the street on 24th) and the Mission Mural Project so all their drinks are inspired by new, local murals! Their menu is always a nice, bound book and makes a great coffee table book. It's a part of my rotation of coffee table books about alcohol (another one of the books in that rotation is a scratch n sniff book on learning how to drink wine). 

Anyways...tldr go to this bar and drink lots!! You won't regret!
author: Lucy W.

description:
Came here after dinner with some friends and this was an amazing place. It's actually quite large with a second floor where mostly people were dining. Downstairs we crowded around the bar. 
The drink menu goes great with the theme and a super plus for those conspiracy theorists. It was a bit crowded for a Wednesday night, but service did not falter. After taking a while to decide on drinks, we placed our orders and chatted with the bar tender. We were asking about the name and the crazy characters and our bartender actually went and grabbed one of the coin banks to show us how the bar got its name. The dog actually does tricks to shoot the coin into the bank!
Our drinks were made in front of us and it was such a masterpiece. Carefully concocted with great attention to detail. The drinks were flavorful and unique. Area 51 is probably one of the coolest one with a stencil of an alien head.
author: Joey L.

description:
Trick Dog has updated their menus with a calendar theme.  The new menus are calendars you can actually buy and the proceeds go to Muttville Senior Dog Rescue and Northern California Family Dog Rescue.  Kudos to Trick Dog for being both creative and charitable.  I stopped by a couple of times to try out the new menu items and few old classic food items as well.

2016 Calendar Menu -- http://bit.ly/1HuVQSI

As usual, the drinks are truly the star attractions.  While they were all pretty good, the most ambitious one I tried was the JULY cocktail.  Mainly because it came garnished with sharp cheddar cheese.  It was a pretty strong drink, but it wasn't until I took a bite of the sharp cheddar that it countered the bitterness of the drink and made it actually pretty enjoyable.  Very clever.  One more drink to note which unfortunately I don't have a pic of is their Scoobysnack shot.  It's a very safe and fruity shot to drink because it's like you're shooting down a liquified Jolly Rancher.

JULY and JUNE cocktails -- http://bit.ly/1Iq98no
JUNE -- Junipero Gin, Trick Dog Cup (apple, cucumber, tea, hibiscus, fig), Dolin rouge vermouth, Bitter Lemon soda 
JULY -- Fighting Cock bourbon, Amaro Lucano, blackberry, Shiraz, Dale's Pale Ale, chipotle, lemon, sharp cheddar

Like before, their drink menu also includes some refreshing mocktails if you don't want to get buzzed.

Summer School  -- http://bit.ly/1T9OTx6
(without proof) papaya, honey, rice, iced tea, key lime

Ski Week -- http://bit.ly/1IRGm0p
(without proof) Trick Dog Cup (apple, cucumber, tea, hibiscus, fig), bitter lemon soda, lemon

The food menu has been changed up again with returning favorites like their famous Trick Dog Burger, Chicken TrickNuggets, Manimal Fries, and Kale Salad, but also a bunch a new items like their Citrus Braised Pork Tacos and Manhattan Sausage.

Updated Food Menu in Calendar -- http://bit.ly/1DuyxxJ

Kale Salad -- http://bit.ly/1EcLOpk
avocado, parmesan, pepitos, slow-cooked egg yolk dressing

Citrus Braised Pork Tacos -- http://bit.ly/1Pa3tEC
pickeled pineapple pico de gallo, radishes, epazote, cumin

Manhattan Sausage -- http://bit.ly/1eWU5H4
Pork belly, cherry mostarda, Old Grand Dad bourbon, johnnycake

This was my first time trying their Kale Salad and it was a little overwhelming when they brought it to our table.  A huge mountain of kale!  It made for a good side dish to split or for a great veggie meal if you're dining solo.  I'd say out of the new menu items that I've tried, the one to get is the Manhattan Sausage.  It's so good and goes well with the provided johnnycakes.  Some might not care for the cherrry mostarda as they might not like the sweet and savory mashup, but for me it works great.  The Tacos were good too, but personally I'd rather have another Trick Dog instead.  I had another Trick Dog recently and it's still a very tasty burger to go well with their cocktails.

Trick Dog still amazes me with their creative menus, crafty cocktails, and delicious food.  What will they come up with next?  Well whatever they will come up with, you'll know I'll be back again to let you guys know since it's one of my favorite bars in SF.
author: Rodney H.

description: Cool concept but ambiance and drinks were not great. It is a small space and gets pretty crowded making it hard to order a drink at the bar. The drinks were pretty weak and very sugary/juicy; not worth the price.
author: Hector S.

description:
REVIWER # 550

The name itself makes me wonder: Trick Dog?! HAHA! I am so happy a friend of mine introduced me to this local bar/restaurant!

Well known for their delicious drinks this place can get crowded! When I first walked up, first thing I heard was the loud noise coming from the bar. Walking in, I was surprised to see so many people. We walked up to the bar and asked for a cocktail menu. The cocktail menu is a uniquely created as an election themed menu where the menu has all the specialty cocktails listed on buttons that is pinned to a big board. What a great creative idea! The buttons also are detailed on not only the name of the drink but also what's in the drink. My friend and I both ordered 2 separate drinks equally 4 different drinks in total and all of them were deliciously good! OMG! Yes, I have to admit the drinks were pricey ($13.00), you do the math. I have to say though, it was totally worth it!

DRINKS: We ordered:
-I Am Not a Crook
-Romanism & Rebellion
-I like Ike
-Morning in America

Once I noticed that there was a upstairs dining area I immediately told my friend we should make our way upstairs. Once we did so, we noticed that the upstairs was a small dining area of no more then 9-10 tables. And it was pretty empty when we arrived at around 7PM. Dinner menu is located on the tables under the plate. It's a small food option but they have great food!!

For food we ordered:

-Chicken Tricknuggets (10/10) I love that it comes with 3 different sauces making it more interesting and not boring eating the same sauce as we ordered 13 pieces. 
-Manimal Style Fries-(7/10) Very unique and tasted really good. Next time I would order it without the Charred Scallions, after a while the taste was too much for me.
Shrimp Roll- (6/10) Way different from how I imagined it was going to come out. Overall it was good but wouldn't be something I go out of my way to order again. 

SERVICE: The service once we made our way to the top of the dining area was good. We had the honor of having the bartender Johvanna. She was good although it took a while for her to crack a smile for us. She came around frequently to check up on our table and what really impressed me was when I had ordered my drinks at the beginning and told her I wanted my 2nd drink about 10 minutes after. 10 minutes came around and my 1st glass was empty. I was starting to get worried that she forgot about me and once I started thinking the worse, she came up to the table with my cocktail! She totally impressed me, especially since she had all the other tables to maintain. There was another server who had such a great personality and positive attitude! His name was Clause. He came around and delivered our food from time to time and I also heard him apologize to other tables for the long wait of food. What great hospitality!

Overall, Trick dog totally earns 4 stars! Not only are their drinks great and unique but the food was good as well and it's such a great hang out spot next to the mission! I would have never heard about this place if it wasn't for my good foodie friend but I am happy I was introduced!

Until next time Trick Dog!

REVIEW 122/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
o o o oo o o is that yo Trick?
why she follow him subscribe to him
cause #foodsnob and them Triiiiiick

why you drink alone why she eat with me

so she can have my apps that's better than yours

author: Dan B.

description: Probably the coolest bar I've ever visited in sf. Packed with many people but good vibes there, nice bartenders, and great cocktails.
author: Hiro H.

description: Veronica S. and I waited outside and made a beeline for the bar as soon as the doors opened at 3:00 PM. What does this say about us?
author: Suany W.

description: This bar crew knows hospitality, and how to make ya feel special. So many bars here i was told to go to, but i spent every night at some point here. Remembered me by name even during my short visit. Couldn't say enough about how great everybody was.
author: Jakob K.

description: I really liked how lively this place was and it was really neat. We first got drinks as we waited on a table which didn't take too long. The food was good and so were the drinks. Apparently they change the theme every so often. It was airline/plane themed when we visited. I tried the kale salad and the chicken tricknuggets which were both really good! I'd definitely check this place out over and over again as the themes change but I was just visiting from out of town unfortunately.
author: Christina B.

description:
The June/July 2015 issue of Esquire magazine chose Trick Dog (along w Specs) for best bar in SF.    

If you've been before, it's easy to understand why this distinguished honor would be bestowed on Trick Dog.

On Monday night, out front gave no clue to what was going on inside.  It was 8ish & it was quiet & looked like nothing was happening.  We walked in, & that was hardly the case.  It wasn't packed (yet), but it certainly wasn't sleepy.

We got the last 2 empty seats at the bar, the lower ones right at the front.  Sweet.

As always, we were immediately welcomed & greeted.  Our bartender was cool & attentive.  

I'm still on the burger kick, so a Trick Dog was in order.  Along w the pork belly sausage dish.

And of course, the thrice cooked fries. 

This burger is better than the burger at Causwells, which is up for best burger in America (?!) on Thrillist.  I'm a fan of Thrillist, but I'm perplexed about this call.  Really perplexed.  

The pork belly sausage w cornmeal pancake was fantastic.  Think deconstructed corn dog, only w high quality components.  

The fries are just divine.  Uber crisp, nice & salty, totally addictive.  Whichever burger wins the "Best Burger in America" contest, these are the french fries that should accompany them.  

We've only eaten at the bar, since we never want to wait for a table upstairs.  But the service is always top notch.  These guys (& girls) are knowledgeable, personable, & have personality.  But there's absolutely no hipster/mixologist attitude.  Props.

He washed it all down w a beer, & I went w one of their signature, innovative, perfect cocktails.

***The Best In Show Dog Calendar menu is fabulous!***Vote for your favorite pooch!  They're for sale for 20 bucks, w all proceeds going to Muttville Dog Rescue.  Love.

From the perfectly executed drinks, the attention paid to detail on everything from cocktail names & the menu that changes every 6 months, to the impressive & delicious (despite being limited) menu, Trick Dog is in a league of its own.  

The Bon Vivants know what they're doing.

Always a good night.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
During this visit to SF I got out and explored a few areas new to me thanks to my good friend Katy! She always has the lowdown on the cool new bars serving up great drinks, bringing the a-game with the atmosphere, and Trick Dog didn't disappoint.

Pulling up to the bar, I felt like we were headed to a house party. Trick Dog is situated on a picture perfect SF suburban street lined with multi story townhomes, and the bar itself is inside one of them. Long and narrow, the main bar area feels like a grate room with extremely high ceilings and a bar that runs the length of the space. Upstairs there are tables and seating for the dining crowd too. The only drawback to the design is it can get a little loud when it's full of people enjoying their drinks. But the crowning design achievement of this bar is the bar shelving itself! Shelves housing a large spirit selection slide hiding some and revealing more! It's fun to watch the staff work and see what they uncover!

As for the drinks, let's start with the menu. They have a simple menu of single spirit drinks. like Gin and Dry Cucumber Soda, but what you want to find are the cute doggie calendars sitting around! Yes, they are actually calendars but they're also menus with a drink named for each month that you can order by name!  Be prepared, these drinks are super crafty, and made with lots of ingredients I have never seen, which just means a great opportunity to learn! I ordered the November, a bourbon drink I know I enjoyed but seriously and sadly cannot describe! Oh yeah, apparently sherry is in these days too, and their menu offers a lot of it, both by the glass and in drinks. But no matter what your preference, their staff is helpful and happy to guide you to the right selection.

Check em out and let me know which month is your favorite!
author: Michael T.

description: Have been here about 5 times. 2 drinks each visit.  Most cocktails are well crafted and intriguing.  Food however has never really matched the quality of the cocktail program in my opinion. I just wish hipsters would collectively decide to give this place a break from time to time. Man buns and beards!
author: Marco M.

description:
I must say, this place was really freaking cool. My three pals and I were lucky enough to arrive at about 4 pm or so on a Thursday, before everyone and their mom and Your Mom got there. 

We were just there for drinks, and took the full opportunity to look at the amazing drink menu with all of its X-files-y imagery and redacted text and nerdy Sci-Fi conspiracy jokes. I was so impressed by the creativity.

We ordered from all over the drink menu, and the bartender was a machine, cranking out these really complex drinks with all kinds of little tinctures and herbs and edible spray paint and the like in them...I got a "Reptilian Elite," a citrusy gin drink, which was pretty good, though probably not the best $13 cocktail I've ever had.

One of my pals, who had been there before and knew the deal, ordered a pina colada, which took some poor bastard about 20 minutes to make, and probably not because he was being lazy but rather because the thing is huge and served inside a pineapple. It cost $30, I think; my friend graciously let each of us have a little sip, and holy mackerel, it was perfect. (If you like pina coladas. And getting caught in the rain. And blah blah blah.)

On the whole, it was good to dip my toe in here, but I don't suppose I'll return for a swim. Sure I gave it 4 stars, but I'm getting too old and boring for crowded, expensive, ultra-hip places like this. I'm pretty sure my drink was far cooler and more interesting than I'll ever be. It's weird to look down at your drink and get the feeling that you're cramping its style. "You'd rather be with someone else," you mumble. "Don't say that," it replies, even as it eyes a 20-something game designer who makes seven figures and wears pajama bottoms to work. A short while later, your drink introduces you to a can of Pabst that it knows, and sneaks away without you noticing...sigh.
author: Chris H.

description:
Meet a friend here for a drink before we went next door for dinner. It was a week day around 5 and it was crowded but not too bad that we couldn't find a place to be comfortable. Maybe a dozen seats at the bar and some smaller tables and rail along the opposite wall. The bartenders were friendly and and it didn't take long to get a drink. 

The cocktail list was better than expected and they had a really good shot and a beer special. Might have been just for happy hour but I still think the beer prices were reasonable. 

The place has a good dive bar vibe. The crowd is super chill, I'd go back for sure.
author: Scott M.

description:
OMGOMGOMGOMGOMG.

Lord have mercy. On my wallet.

And my liver.

Trick Dog is the bar that I've always wanted to have in my neighborhood, but then, it decided to put itself in the Mission. 

OK. I guess God really did have mercy on me.

The Bon Vivants group live up to the definition of their name: persons who are sociable and enjoy a luxurious lifestyle. While the bar itself is casual and not the least bit luxurious as their group name suggests, you come to Trick Dog to socialize, eat, drink and be merry. The bar area has that friendly feel where you can easily strike up a conversation with your bartender. Or the person next to you who's been eyeing your Thrice cooked french fries. (guard it with your life if you ordered it manimal style!)

Being a mighty competitor in the James Beard awards, Trick Dog constantly strives to become better each year. The cocktail menu gets a complete overhaul every 6 months and they're known for having a theme each time they make a switch. We went in here for the 2016 calendar cocktails (and if you bought the calendar, part of the proceeds go to SF SPCA) These guys are absolutely talented and wholly creative. Who would've thought to put ingredients like sunflower seeds, sandalwood and sharp cheddar in cocktails? It sounds weird, but it works at Trick Dog. I love the spicy-fruity contrasts of the March cocktail: Diplomatico white rum, Ancho chile liqueur, strawberry, lime and Campari.  My guy friends tend to go more for the brown sugar so November is perfect for them. It had Old Forrester Bourbon, pear & pecan vermouth and Mandarin Napoleon. For those who love chocolate and booze, the August cocktail has a malted milk ball garnish. Interestingly enough, this cocktail is made with Tequila Ocho Reposado which plays well with Amaro and Fino sherry. It's a boozy cocktail so don't be fooled by the small goblet. 

The bar centric food served in their upstairs restaurant is really, really good. I can't believe I'm raving about something non-fried and non-fattening, but the mountainous kale salad with slow cooked egg yolk parmesan dressing is absolutely delicious! After all, we do need to get our greens in ;-) Follow that with their meaty housemade sausage with pancakes, chicken trick nuggets and of course, MORE fries.

You've won me over the moment I sat down at that bar stool. I came for the cocktails, stayed for the food and now you've got another follower. Trick Dog is definitely, a (wo)man's best friend.
author: Janice C.

description: Heard about this place from a few people to try out. Not too interested in the cocktail menu. Cool vibe and cute spot but not too intriguing of a menu as well as kind of tucked in (location is quite far from other spots). I would've found the spot a lot more intriguing if any of the bartenders had personality. Very bland communication and straight to the point. I will probably come back but mostly in hopes to have a better experience.
author: Erica S.

description:
Omg I really liked this place.

It's very dark and casual.  

The chicken nuggets we ordered were outstanding! The best nuggets I've ever had!  We also ordered an amazing kale salad that was massive. It was a mountain of salad!! The two of us could only eat half of it! Lol. It was just tons of kale. Delicious none the less!   I would definetly recommend these two items off the menu.

I also enjoyed the cocktail menu in the former of a dog calendar.   Superb idea! 

Check this place out!
author: Sukh R.

description: Tasty cocktails. The small plates were good. Steak tartare was great, ceviche tostadas were average except for being really spicy. Brussels sprouts were good (could lose the mushroom component. I don't think it really complements the dish) squash toast thing was pretty tasty. The staff were really friendly but the place was so packed it took 20 minutes for my second cocktail to arrive. We were long done eating by then and I regretted ordering it.  I was also not thrilled by how loud it was in there.
author: Nancy H.

description:
TL;DR - The BEST bar in the area. No joke.

It is always crowded. The drinks are always amazing. The bartenders are friendly.

I can't attest to the food as I don't really make a meal of bar hopping, but the pictures look amazing~

Yes, the drinks are a little pricier, but that's because they are strong and delicious. The menu changes frequently, and its ALWAYS something creative. I've never had to order the same drink here because I always find something new that I love.

Be warned, its crowded almost always. Its loud. So don't expect to whisper romantically.

BUT you will be surrounded (and meet) amazing people and try great drinks. So... worth it :]
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Came to Trick Dog on a whim and was incredibly impressed by the experience. It's a smaller, more intimate space with a great ambiance. Younger, hip crowd for sure. The bartenders and staff are all very attentive and friendly. Music is fun. It can get crowded though so beware of that.

What makes this place stand out though is their innovative cocktails. They offer artisan cocktails that have been unparalleled in their peculiarity and also great taste. Got to trust the bartenders on this one because they love to experiment and take risks but in a way that manages to beat your expectations. Disappointing that I don't live in SF and so I can't really visit!
author: Kayla U.

description: The trickdog nuggets are AMAZING! Very high quality white meat chicken with a perfect crispy breaking. We ended up buying several orders because we kept eating them all. The drinks are pretty good as well.
author: Eric W.

description: I loved this place so much.  Delicious cocktails, cute interior, delicious food (especially the kale salad which is massive and the chicken nuggets).  I would eat here every week.
author: Brandon S.

description: This space is so cool! I came here with kids for a summer cooking camp during the day and we had a mocktail lesson with Alfie. All the campers had a great time and the staff present were so willing to accommodate and entertain the kids. They were also kind enough to open up their kitchen space to us so we could cook lunch with the campers. Our kids definitely had a blast hanging out here all day and our counselor staff is already trying to plan a time to go back and visit during regular operating hours!
author: Rylee P.

description:
Awesome space. The best is upstairs. So, my recommendation is to go there a bit hungry for food as well as drinks because then you'll have an excuse to go up. The staff is friendly and the drinks go down way too easily. I wouldn't mind it being a bit less noisy or less crowded. Their menu with the Pin Back buttons is adorable.

Where's that gnome door???
author: Yad L.

description:
Date night and cocktails!

We got the Vogue and it was really tasty. 

Corn salad and tartar were spoton. 

Protip: ask for a seat upstairs. It'll be easier to order drinks and snacks.
author: George K.

description:
Trick Dog is clearly no best-kept-secret any longer in San Francisco - considering they've been nominated for the James Beard Awards Outstanding Bar Program at least once, that's probably an understatement. On a Saturday afternoon, less than an hour after opening, this little joint was completely packed, and for pretty good reason.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Dark, trendy interior with limited, coveted seating
+ The coolest sci-fi themed menus with clever drink names & design
+ Nice, patient bartenders who handle large crowds with ease
~ Regular drink concoctions on their changing menu can be a tad hit or miss, but it's possible we just misordered

I would happily come back to try more drinks, although I'm guessing arriving at opening is the only sure-fire way to ensure you grab a seat easily.
author: Claire S.

description: No one ever answers the phone here!!! Tried to get a reservation and apparently no one works there.
author: Marissa W.

description: Wonderful staff, amazing drinks, and welcoming atmosphere! Chef/Bartender Alfie was kind enough to open the bar early to teach 16 campers from Sprouts Cooking Club a few of his tricks including how to make fresh pasta, ricotta, and mocktails. Although we weren't in the restaurant during service, the charisma of the staff made it clear that Trick Dog is an amazing place to spend an evening!
author: Isamu B.

description: Fantastic noms! Had the tacos and Vogue cocktail (delish by the way! Nice and smoky with a splash of citrus). The pupusas were not what I was expecting, I'm used to corn and these were flour, but still yummy. Also tried the soba noodle salad and OMG the fries are BOMB! thanks to our server Samantha for taking care of us  see you again soon!
author: Alyssa S.

description: Amazing cocktail joint right by my office. Had 3 cocktails, each of which were spectacular. The friendly waitstaff even gave us free fries! Will definitely come back.
author: Roxy W.

description:
Wow what a night this ended up being. I still remember the beginning very vividly: two fantastic drinks from their ever-changing themed menu, amazingly delicious Manimal style fries, and tasty chicken "trick"nuggets with equally tasty dipping sauces, including one very nasal-clearing Chinese mustard, all amidst an incredibly loud and packed bar.

The rest of the night? A little fuzzier. Apparently two additional drinks were imbibed, some women were talked to, and more food was had, as the three of us ended up spending about $70 each. Oh... snap.

As for the venue itself - aside from it being insanely packed - it also had two separate levels, with the lower/main level being the one with the bar, and, well, most of the people.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - So, this is a tough one. If the place wasn't busy, then it'd be rather spacious, but as is usually the case (on a Friday night at least), according to the bartenders, the place is super packed, so getting around is definitely not an easy feat. There's a lower wheelchair accessible part of the bar near the front entrance though, and the bouncer was kind enough to clear people out of the way for us. After that, movement was avoided as much as possible.

Bathroom - These are all the way in the very back, which would normally pose a problem, given the crowds, but they happen to be shared with Central Kitchen, so you only have to fight through a FEW people, back through the front entrance, and go around through the restaurant into the restrooms, which I believe were completely accessible.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I hate to give this place a low rating, because I really did like the food there, and the kale salad is probably going to be my go-to method of preparing kale from now, on but a combination of an extremely hot room, horrible service, and high prices make me have to give this place a two star rating.

Parking: The parking at this location is actually not as bad as you would think it would be. It's located on the less crowded side of the mission distract, so ti's pretty possible to find parking spots on the street side.

Atmosphere/restaurant: the actual restaurant/bar itself is kind of weird. I don't think there actually was a sign for the establishment out front, but that gave it kind of a "speakeasy" feel to it. That being said, it was super confusing, and we catually had to resort to asking a patron near the entrance of the bar if it was the right place. I get the whole theme, but when it ends up being an inconvenience, I definltey think something different should be done. Also, the loft on the second floor that is used for a dining area was extremely stuffy and crowded. I get that it might a cocktail bar before a restaurant, but the least you can do is turn on some kind of AC for the 20+ people stuck up there. The tables were way too close together and it was burning hot, it was also extremely dark.

Food: The food itself was overall very good. They had a very limited menu(which we found out was changed every 6 months actually).  Some definite recommendations I have are probably the kale salad and the thrice-fried fries. The fries were very crispy, and although I usually hate thicker fries, I really  did love them. 

Some things I would definitely say to stay away from are some of their weirder drinks. I got the Trick Dog Root beer and really was pretty  much surprised by how bad it could be. I didn't epect anything super amazing, but it just tasted so weird, it was hard to believe it was an $8 drink.

Service: Probably the worst part, and one of the biggest part of eating at restaurants for me  was the service here.  Not only did our server take forever to get anything done, I feel like we ended up sitting down for 2 hours and some change although the meal was only for 4. She also seemed like she was really angry/pissed to have to deal with the very basic things that we  were asking.
author: Andrew T.

description:
This place is all about those Cocktails!

Their Menu looked like a story book... the bartender was pretty good and she was making each cocktail with perfection unlike some bars where they 'multi-task' and make many at once with possibly zero flavors!

We went in on a Saturday afternoon and I think I love this place for the light, chirpy crowd and the feel of a local pub outside Mission. Would love to go back!
author: Pranamee S.

description:
Really cool spot for some interesting hand crafted cocktails with really fresh ingredients. I told the bartender I wanted something fruity and she made me a specialty drink which was tasty and not too sweet.
I would recommend this place as a great place to go to for an after work dinner & drinks.
author: Jen H.

description:
5 Stars for its creative concept and solid drinks. There isn't a bar out there quite like Trick Dog's! 

Every couple months they come out with a new theme/idea/concept. Previous concepts have included vinyl records, Zodiac signs, a San Francisco tourist map and finally a Chinese takeout menu.Their food offerings are usually pretty much the same, but their drinks change/rotate accordingly.


I came here with Suany W. and we had so much fun. We came here last year during their "Chinese takeout" menu. I had the #1 Boduilige Shuang (Don Q anejo rum, brandy, lime) and the #2 Qincai he Boluo (Plymouth Gin, Pineapplee, Lime, Gardenia) - each drink is $13.

We also ordered the Thrice cooked fries.. and these were amazing. So crispy on the outside but with a substantial amount of soft and yummy potatoeness inside.

Overall - Trick Dog is a fun bar in the Mission that's great to go with friends or bring and impress your out-of-towners to. The bar itself is no-frills but the drinks are stiff and delicious and the changing "Concept" or "Themes" keep this place a fun one to return to again and again!
author: Veronica S.

description:
I liked this place a lot. Maybe it was because I came in the late afternoon and it was almost empty inside but everything I experienced here was excellent.

My friend and I came in after a meal around the corner. The drink menu was quirky and I didn't really see anything that grabbed my attention. I ended up ordering an old fashion and the bartender made one of the best drinks I had in a while. My friend ended up also getting a great drink too.

The bartender was very friendly and we struck up a conversation about bars up in Portland. I mentioned that this bar reminded me a lot of this other great bar in Portland and he talked about how he liked that bar a lot too.

The decor had high ceilings and I believe there was another bar on the mezzanine or upper level which we didn't bother to check out.

There was just a cool vibe about the place. Maybe I'd think different if I came on a Saturday night but I really dug this bar.
author: Art O.

description: Interesting cocktails and menu. I kept calling my drink the hedgwig,that's not what it's called, but the bartenders knew what I was talking about an kept pouring my drinks. Cool and causal atmosphere. Would definitely come back!
author: Samantha E.

description:
In town for a work retreat thing -- Wednesday night was Californios -- which I'll review shortly -- but I had to get down a 5-star for this spot. It seemed like everyone we talked to was crowing about "the hottest spot in SF" or something like that. We were a little skeptical, which I think is an LA thing... But really: weird name, kinda out of the way, how great could it be?
We showed up on Thursday night and it seemed like most of SF was inside. Luckily we were able to wedge our way through the toe-to-toe bar area and get a table upstairs -- PRO TIP: if you're eating dinner you can claim sanctuary on this upstairs island and be served almost immediately, plus you won't have to have some tech kid's Allbirds scuffing up your nice kicks.
Here's where it gets good -- our server was a probably 6'6" tall SF cool-kid with a man-bun -- picture an LA hipster, except actually cool. As good as everything else was -- and it was... This guy made our night (His name was possibly misremembered as Shawn?). When you talk about good service -- casual attitude, welcoming vibe, inclusive style -- this guy was the gold standard. We felt cooler just having him associate with us.
ANYWAY -- the food menu was unreal -- amazingly varied and exciting, and probably the most UNDER-PRICED food we saw on our trip. Now, I'm as much a philistine as the next guy, and I'm not trying to blow up any spots, but for real -- in the land of the $20 burger (yes, SF, that's you) -- this place had a blue-chip menu w/ nothing above ~$14. We took down pretty much the whole menu between the group, and legit-EVERYTHING was a 5/5.
Now for the cocktails -- the menu was a McSweeney's non-profit-benefiting, Dr. Seuss-esque, hardcover, rhyming, illustrated children's book. There's no other way to describe it. It was unreal. When we asked Shawn(?) about it he told us they actually SWITCH menu styles every 6 months and the previous was something like a secret agent dossier thing. Hot damn. Talk about above-and-beyond.
Tried just about all the drinks, which is why I will have trouble telling you which to order... But one came w/ ham and cheese on a toothpick as an "appetizer"... One had a miniature p&j sando as a garnish... There's a tiki-style one that has ancho chili that was a huge hit.
Basically, in an oversaturated, overpriced city -- this place made a HUGE impression. So much so that we came back TWO NIGHTS LATER. And guess who was working the door? Badass man-bun Shawn(?), except now he had his hair down and looked even more chill. As if that were even possible. To cap the whole experience, he actually recognized us right away and made us feel like we were regulars at Cheers. Damn. Trick Dog, you do it right. Never change.
author: K F.

description: This review is of their service only. Bouncer and crew are super nice! I got sick (was completely sober so not related to their drinks) and they quickly took care of me and didn't shoo me away. They gave me a cold bottle of water and tons of napkins. Genuinely sweet.
author: Hope N.

description: A great little hipster place hiding in Mission!  Noticed the dark wood, artisan architecture as soon as I stepped in the door. Simply stunning.  Lends to great ambiance and a cozy feeling.  Went on a Monday night and the place was absolutely packed. Fun crowd, great tunes and interesting drinks. They make one specialty drink in a bronze rooster cup. Lol. It is somewhat of a small place so if you're coming with a larger group it might be difficult to get a spot to sit or stand. Overall fun place to hang out for a fun drinks with friends.
author: Tonya W.

description: I have been here twice and it's great! They have a rotating menu of delicious and novel cocktails. The atmosphere is comfortable and upscale and exciting. Haven't eaten here. No complaints.
author: Ryan E.

description: Went in with some friends on Tuesday and we were dazzled by the friendliness and mixology skills of the staff! What a lovely group of folks and an incredible airline-themed menu. I ordered the Stockholm and it was simply divine! LOVE this spot-don't miss it!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for quite some time.

The crop circle is a whiskey cocktail that is DANGEROUSLY amazing. Literally tasted like a refreshing mint water, could've downed it but then I'd be downing $13 haha.

As for the food, the kale salad is definitely a must order. It's a mountain of kale, which was surprising. Also, it would be a crime not to try the entree named after the bar itself. The trick dog is tasty and did not disappoint. 

All in all, the hype was justified from a cocktail perspective. But the food isn't too shabby either.
author: Aaron C.

description: Best place in SF for creative cocktails. Bonus points for the really, really great food.
author: Angelo S.

description: Really fun bar, cool vibe, the bartenders are friendly. These drinks are on another level! I didn't love the drink I ordered (last-picked demagogue) but it was so much fun I'm willing to go back and try more.
author: Holland M.

description: This place is an awesome little hole in the wall. Great drinks and bar bites! It's small so you may have to fight for a seat (minimalist Vibes). Ladies - if you are meeting a date here, were shoes that you can stand in for a while. Cocktails are delicious and would highly recommend anything they make with Gin here.
author: Jenny C.

description:
It's not often that we get out for drinks much anymore.  But after our meal in the area with friends we walked over to Trick Dog.  It was busy and we got there just in time because by the time we left the place was packed.  They have an extensive menu which was kind of hard to narrow down what to get.  I got the Chupacbra and it was really good.

The drinks were expensive so I wouldn't hang out here all night but it's a cool spot with lots of action and good drinks.
author: Blake B.

description: Best cocktail place in sf without a doubt. Their cocktails have high alcohol content and bang for the buck. The cocktails are very well made and they keep rotating them based on inspirations.
author: Ash M.

description:
Great spot for delicious cocktails. I have been here a few times and had varied experiences (from GREAT to meh). 
DRINKS: Yes, they are expensive (but what do you expect - this is SF). But - they are quite delicious with unique mixology and cool items like homemade bitters/syrups, etc. The menu is CRAZY LONG and actually kinda hard to handle. I understand the cool concept of having these unique menus but fumbling around a confidential file with 12 + drinks, long descriptions, while trying to squish your way up towards the bar full of over crowded people yelling over loud music... not too fun. that being said - 
ATMOSPHERE: This place is small, you enter in the bar and they do offer dining seating upstairs. I came here once right after they opened for service and scored a great seat at the bar, had amazing service and was really able to enjoy my drink. However, the other times I have come it was over crowded, people were a bit sloppy - spilling their $15 cocktail on me and almost impossible to get a drink. 
A great place to check out if you are in the area. I recommend getting there early unless you don't mind standing. 
cheers.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Drinks here are stellar and I love that they have a rotating menu. Right now (as of May 2016), the theme is enigmas so you have drinks honoring Area 51, the Loch Ness, Crop Circles, etc. Also, the quality of the drinks are high -- I've had the BEST old fashioned of my life here and their mixology is top-notch. They have a downstairs that gets fairly packed and an upstairs, which is more of a restaurant/sit down place.

I really think they could expand given their popularity. It gets super packed at the bar which I think takes away from the ambiance since we're packed like sardines in the room.  Food looks really good and very reasonably priced!

Come when it's not busy - otherwise you'll be standing at the bar for a long time.
author: Cindy W.

description:
+Concept and décor.  Has the feeling of a nice little speakeasy type place with legit bartenders.  Ambiance is cute

+Drinks.  Lots of original cocktails that were tasty.

- - - WAY TOO CROWDED!  I don't even know why they allowed in so many people in the night I came.  There was absolutely no place to stand, people kept running into my drunk so I kept spilling it.  We grabbed a drink or two and left to find a place where we can talk and hang out

Overall: I would come back again on a week night perhaps when it wasn't so crowded.  I felt way too claustrophobic and there was way too many people running into me to enjoy my drink.
author: Mui K.

description:
Trick dog is a really good date spot. it's loud, but i find it intimate at the same time (is that weird). i like all their drinks since it changes monthly and they're pretty creative with the menu too. 

the food is good too, from what i remember. what i really like about this place is that there's always parking in the area and there are plenty of good bars around to go to after.

i actually thought it was a hot dog place the first time i came here -  i was pleasantly surprised that it was not.
author: Andy H.

description: Good, creative drinks and menu set up for the cocktails. The bartenders were fast and friendly. The kale salad was a bit underwhelming considering all of the raving reviews I've read about it. But overall, this was a nice spot for drinks and especially a great waiting spot if you're waiting for a table at Flour + Water.
author: Kim L.

description:
Based on other reviews and photos I was worried all the food here was going to be super oily and just bar food. While it is bar food, they do class it up a bit and everything was tasty. Especially the Chicken Nuggets. We also tried to go healthy with asparagus, which our friends were confused by, but they were a lighter alternative to have on the table. 

The place is loud as is expected, but cool ambiance, good music, nice doorman etc so good choice overall for those in their 30's.
author: Sami N.

description:
Great spot for a cocktail ! We stopped by after diner Saturday night. Place was packed to the rafters but service was quick 

Drinks were great. I had the Jurassic fog which was so good I had two ! My wife tried classic cosmo which wasn't as good. 

Good spot though if you fancy a cocktail. Not much seating was marginal drawback.....
author: Stu K.

description: A friend of mine mentioned that this was one of the top places in SF for cocktails. I replied and said oh really let me yelp it. Then after yelping it I realized I had already been here a while back lol honestly wasn't that memorable to me since the drinks were mediocre. Only good thing are the chicken nuggets.
author: Diane L.

description: Awesome cocktails and love the unique menu, comprised of local wall mural art around San Francisco. The only downside is that it's a fairly small bar and it can get packed. Thankfully, the bartenders do their best to stay attuned as each new customer walks in to ensure everyone is served. Appreciate the attentiveness!
author: Katherine C.

description: Worst customer service! The female bartender with the short hair was a major pill. Sure she was swamped with making drinks but that's your job lady so don't take it out on the customers!! Only reason why I'm giving this place two stars instead on one is because of their drinks. In that area this place did not disappoint!
author: Sue J.

description:
I had this place bookmarked for ages after hearing stories of the clever, odd, and sometimes downright hilarious cocktail menu themes. 

We went late on a Saturday evening and while it was crowded, it was totally manageable. There is limited seating at the bar, but additional seating upstairs (although I'm not sure if this is only for those also ordering food). 

First, the service. I was super impressed with the service from the bartenders that evening. It was about 2-3 deep at the bar and somehow this gentleman was spotting people as they came in and immediately passing over menus and taking orders. No need to breathe down the back of anyone at the front, or do the awkward "please meet my gaze" eyes at the bartender. 

Next, the drinks. The menu when we went was presented in a "Top Secret" folder and featured drinks crafted around famous conspiracy theories. It was well executed and fun to read through while we waited for our orders. The drinks were delicious, just the right amount of "ooh, what's *that*" added, without screwing up perfectly good booze. 

We left to head to a quieter joint, but would definitely be back for another date night or with a group of friends. Can't wait to see the next menu!
author: Brittany B.

description: The most incredible drinks. Everything tastes great. And the kale salad is unbelievable. A must visit bar when in San Francisco. It does get very busy so get there early if you want to get a seat.
author: Ronak M.

description: Takes too long to get drinks, super hot inside and won't keep door open to let air in. Drinks are good though, so check it out. Loud inside, so not the place to hold a conversation.
author: Sebastian G.

description:
Trick Dog is one of my favorite bars in the city! It's crazy how the area surrounding has changed so much since the first time I came about 2 years ago, but it's definitely become an up and coming neighborhood with tons of cool restaurants and things nearby.

The bar menu regularly changes with an overall theme for all of the cocktails. The first time I came they had zodiac inspired drinks, which I loved because I'm really into astrology. On my last visit they had election inspired drinks in light of what was then the upcoming election.

I really wish I could remember the name of the drinks I got but I totally forgot to take a picture of the menu. One think I will say is that all of their cocktails are nice and strong, so you're really getting your money's worth. My favorite was this drink kind of similar to a pina colada, which had rum, avocado, a few other mix ins and a delicious coconut flavored cream on top!

I definitely recommend coming to Trick Dog if you haven't already. They get pretty busy but if you're lucky enough to come a little early and get a spot at the bar you'll have a great time!
author: Jaymie S.

description: Trick Dog is a great bar to come to for a drink after work, or to hang with friends at. The bar is small, so it does get pretty crowded and cramped often. With that being said, they have a great assortment of beers, but they are really known for their wacky cocktails. The bartenders here are truly mixologists, and are taking drops of this, and mixing and shaking them with hints of that. If you are looking for fun cocktails, this is your stop.
author: Ross S.

description: Amazing drinks, food, and atmosphere. Great for group gatherings and highly recommend staying for dinner and sharing plates, family style. LOVE the book-style drink menus, so cute!
author: Toni A.

description:
The atmosphere is great ! But being a native San Franciscan I must say I never like giving into the gentrification and buying a $15 drink ! 

But with that said they were great drinks ! The food was fair but again over priced ! Welcome to SF ! 

Luckily there was a non profit party going on around the corner with free beer with your donation ! Now that's the SF I love !
author: S R.

description: Amazing cocktails with ingredients made from scratch!  I got the "I Like Ike" and "Romanism & Rebellion." The menu was so unique.  It was all buttons, graphic designed with catchy titles that related to the presidential campaign and had the recipes on them.  The Chicken Trick Nuggets and Freedom Fries were so good! I really liked the vibe of this place.
author: Elise G.

description:
I can see why this place gets so packed... and as much as I hate packed craft cocktail bars, I'd come back here any time. Why? 

1. The vibe is good, regardless of the crowd.
2. The service is super quick, regardless of the crowd. I rarely had to wait to order and never waited long for a beverage. 
3. The drinks are spot on. Amazing quality, creativity and craft. 
4. The menu concepts here are awesome. Currently they have a dogs n donuts calendar as the menu. I love that. 
5. The lack of pretense is real. Friendly, welcoming, and non-judgmental. There are a certain few craft cocktail bars in SF that could learn a lot from this. 

I haven't had the food here, but I look forward to dining some day. All I know is that the drinks I had (and the more that I sampled) were all strikingly delicious, well balanced, inventive, new and creative. 

You can teach an old dog new tricks.
author: Don B.

description: Have been to Trick Dog several times pretty much for the cocktails which have always ranked IMHO  up there in the top of San Francisco's very short list of truly great craft cocktail bars. I love their seasonal changing cocktail menu which  is based on a new theme. Also have had their Trick Dog before which is a must! This evening I went with a party of about 10 people and sat upstairs having the opportunity to taste many of the food items on their menu as well. OMG everything was incredible! From the chicken nuggets to the kale salad and even the french fries and tacos..... it was all really really good.
author: Steven B.

description: So fun.  Delicious cocktails,yummy food.  I am still thinking about the Soba salad. Would totally go back!
author: Anne G.

description:
Great HH spot. Haven't been for dinner yet, but definite will be at some point. 

The drinks are well-balanced and delicious - so many great options to choose from. Of the ones we have tried, Alcatraz was the best.

Food here is also stellar. Really appreciate the attention to quality, fresh, seasonal ingredients. 

A short-list spot for sure.
author: Rachael S.

description: Trick Dog is pretty awesome! It's a bit too small of a place for me but otherwise a great bar to start off a great evening. I recommend starting off here for a drink or two then moving on to the next. The main lobby is for drinks and social gatherings while the top floor is for sit-downs and food. I personally don't like how tight spaced this bar can get; elbow to elbow type atmosphere which isn't pleasing. It can get hot and too packed inside. The drinks are on point as well as their bartenders! They're efficient, quick, but take their time at the same time in order for their cocktails to be at it's highest grade. I suggest ordering an original type cocktail such as an old-fashioned then maybe ordering a cocktail off their menu.
author: Allister D.

description:
Came here for drinks after dinner.  It's nestled away in the mission district, next to Central Kitchen.

We came on a Friday night, it was packed.  The drinks here are creepers, but super tasty.  The zodiac drink menu was a great touch. I ordered a "Leo" 

Everyone agreed the "Leo" was the best drink.  They all had to ordered it next.  Drinks run about $10.  Didn't try the bar food, but hope to next time.
author: Angelica C.

description: This place has decent food. And even a good cocktail menu if you take time to decipher from its themes. I even enjoyed the patrons as well as talking to the staff. And I think there is something I'm missing because they had me leave after one drink and an entrè. Confusing enough is that I was told a complaint was made.  On further review it was likely interaction with the female staff.  Perhaps I presented a threat. Nice but there is much to be desired.  They had me leave for a reason I feel is malicious. I don't write reviews but this signals to me that I should speak up and tell others to avoid this business. Based on their judgement I can say that something is wrong. Not Right.  No outrage but at least make that apparent in a manner that coincides with other "controlled demographic" institutions (businesses). I urge you to question this business and judge it by what you see inside.
author: Mario G.

description:
Dropped in with a friend this past Sunday to grab a couple of drinks and the Trick Dog burger with the Manimal fries.  Can't really go wrong at this spot if you love craft cocktails, and the clientele was looking good when I arrived.  Occupancy signs say they can fit 49 peeps but you can tell that there are times when this place is packed way beyond that, but if you can score a seat at the bar (or the low seats near the window on the right side when facing the main bar), you'll be doing just as fine as I was on my visit.  The burger was good, but a little small; fries were loaded, nice crisp on the potatoes with the plate.  (Apparently they are triple cooked.  I don't think that's necessary, but I'll play along like it might be.)

Tried the March, June, July and December drinks, and would recommend them to anyone.

Just because I see the word "hipster" in other reviews, and America has fallen in love with saying "hipster" every time they see someone with a mustache, some art, a shaker in their hands and a smile, I'll play along.  This isn't a hipster bar, it's a bar where the food and the drinks are amazing.  If that's hipster, count me in.
author: Justin B.

description:
It's been 6 months, which means a new Trick Dog menu!  Check it out here: http://www.alcademics.com/2015/07/trick-dogs-new-best-in-show-doggie-calendar-cocktail-menu.html

I was here with Brad G's party and he pretty much wrote a novel detailing all 12 drinks so I'll just share my thoughts on select cocktails :)

July (Comet): Definitely the best drink on the new menu because it is most complex.  I normally prefer spirit forward drinks served up and do not like highballs but this one is actually worth drinking.  (Although my fried who prefers less alcoholic tasting drinks would disagree.)  The bourbon presence is very strong, as well as the blackberry.  The lemon is not overpowering.  The amaro, wine, and beer add complexity in a way that I cannot pinpoint, I just know I like it.  The aged cheddar is presented on a toothpick laid on top of the glass (not submerged in the drink) and you therefore get it only in the nose and it totally works.  Lastly I'll admit, another reason I enjoy this cocktail is because drinking gives me the munchies for salty food so the cheese is a pleasant snack :)

September (Juno): The bartender put it best - tastes like scotch apple juice.  It was a good summery scotch drink but I was disappointed that it tasted more like apple than the advertised stone fruit.  I was also disappointed I couldn't taste the dill even though they put in a good sized sprig - maybe it would have helped if they spanked it first to release some of the oils?

December (Charlie): Solid but basically a rye old fashioned.  I can't comment much on the sandalwood (what does that taste like??), but the coconut was subtle and the coffee was undetectable, which was disappointing because that flavor combination has so much potential!

August (Mo): My second favorite drink because of how it develops on your palate.  You taste the tequila up front, then peanut butter (I swear it's true!), then finishes with a lighter sherry note.  And who doesn't enjoy a spirit-soaked Whopper once they finish their drink?
author: Beatrice W.

description:
With a mission to drink at every signature cocktail bar in America, I decided to round up the troops to meet at Trick Dog to celebrate my birthday Saturday night, and man, what a f***ing night!

If you do not know, they always update their cocktail menu with a different theme at least a couple of times of year, and right now, it's appropriately election themed and carefull crafted cocktails.

Everything is great, but I personally loved the Bill Clinton inspired cocktail.

Also, if you didn't catch dinner beforehand, your good to go with the Big Mac Dog or the Cheese Fries. They really nailed how to reinvent bar eats to a whole other level!
author: Roman V.

description:
This is one of my FAV Cocktails Bars in the City ! The Vibe is really warm and I absolutely love the finger food too ! 

1. Cool Vibe - CHECK 
2. Amazing Cocktails - CHECK 
3. Good finger food - CHECK 

" If I had 2 more hands, I would give it 4 thumbs up"
author: Amit T.

description:
Trick Dog is a complicated place. When that happens, it always helps to weigh the pros and cons in order to give a balanced review.

CON: 
Its cultural appropriation of "the Chinese restaurant," the theme shaping the food/drink menus and decor here for the past 5 months.
PRO:
The play on "the Chinese restaurant," while definitely annoying to me as an Asian American, doesn't turn me off so bad that I ignore the merits of the RIDICULOUSLY delicious Trick Dog burger and other well-done dishes I've had here. In general, I've found the food consistently tasty, somewhat original, and not too crazily priced. The cocktails, which I consider more expensive than the food, are equally well-crafted.

CON: 
Its always loud, occasionally douchey, and by-and-large invasive clientele (with regards to relationship to the neighborhood), who pack themselves like sardines on the main floor nightly... even during the week.
PRO:
As much as I try not to be loud and douchey, I myself am an invasive species to the Mission. Yes, I own it. Though this doesn't change the fact that I still hate how crowded it gets downstairs at night or how some of the people here are simply obnoxious (but, maybe no more than at any other bar in SF).

CON:
Its failure to take reservations for dinner upstairs, as well as its refusal to seat people upstairs unless you are sitting down for a proper meal.
PRO:
Besides the time I couldn't make reservations here for my birthday, the dining room rules don't bother me much. It's pretty easy to score a table for two on most evenings. And on most visits, I do come for the food anyway, not just the drinks.

CON:
The hype. Oh, the hype.
PRO: 
Maybe it kind of/sort of lives up to its hype? In terms of the food, drinks, and relatively fun atmosphere (minus the borderline racist stuff... but, I've seen worse).


I guess I do like it here. So like my quasi-gentrifier status, I guess I'll just embrace it.
author: Kate V.

description: First time here and I enjoyed the cocktails and food. I got the nachos w/ black mole ground beef... seriously delicious! The two specialty drinks with tequila on the menu were very tasty and unlike some specialty drinks that leave you wondering if there is any alcohol in them because you can't feel it at all, after one, I was feeling pretty happy. Kudos to the chef ... I'm on the hunt for black mole! And big thumbs up to the bartender who rocked the drinks and didn't forget about me when the place got super crowded. The menus = Awesome!
author: Jeannette M.

description:
Great spot in the neighborhood for fantastic craft cocktails. Great vibes, great service - although it may take some time to get your drink, understandably because people love to come here. But come on the early side and try a few different cocktails. Great place to be with friends or a date. 

Definitely get the pina colada - it's served in a whole pineapple 

Go here!
author: Tom T.

description: This is a pretty cool bar to catch up with some friends.  But you'd probably have to do it standing.  The seating in this bar is limited and lined against the wall, with the bar on the other side.  The bar is clean and well-lit, but that bathroom is way down the back hall.  There's only one TV, so if you're looking to watch the game, we'd recommend going elsewhere.  I will say that once we bought a $30 lucky Pina Colada (that came in a pineapple!), the GSW started winning and ultimately came back to win Game 6.  You might look foolish carrying around that pineapple in a bar, but rock it with pride...as it was the best tasting Pina Colada I've ever had!
author: Jeff T.

description:
After moving to the Bay Area from Minnesota, this was the first bar I ever went to in the city. And let me tell you, it is by far one of my favorite bars in the country. 

The ambience, the decor, even the design of the menu is amazing. 

I honestly have tried almost every drink on their menu but my favorite by far is the I like Ike. It's very smooth, a little sweet, and it even comes with sprinkles.

Definitely an awesome addition to the mission.
author: Lorraine A.

description:
Last Friday my son and I made a trip out to the Mission District to check out Trick Dog before heading to AT&T Park for the Giants game. We got there a bit after 3:00, right after they opened.  We were very disappointed to learn that food isn't served until 5:00, but that on is on me because I didn't do research ahead of time.  So we proceeded to do a little day drinking.

I had the #9 cocktail which was mixed with bourbon, kumquat cordial and walnut-infused Fernet Branca.  My son had a drink from the menu that resembled a Manhattan.  We were over the moon with our drinks.

Being a middle aged guy, I'm always a little sensitive about going into places that some people categorize as hipster joints.  It wasn't an issue here as the two bartenders that served us were fabulous.  They were prompt and were patient with our questions about the drinks.  

One other thing about Trick Dog: They change the entire theme of the establishment ever six months, from the décor to the drinks to the food.  I really liked the cheap Chinese restaurant theme, but I understand the next iteration is going to happen in the next few weeks.  I'm looking forward to returning to experience the new Trick Dog, as well as to finally sample their food.

Four stars, just because I didn't get to try the food.  I'll update my review upon my next visit!
author: David W.

description:
First, let me say that... being a real Chinese that is fresh off the boat... the Chinese menu is pretty funny and not that offensive. It paints a vivid picture of American Chinese to me -- an era of ignorance that spawned many Chinese restaurants who still serve fortune cookies till this day.

Humour is bound to offend someone though. It's a bold move, but I think that sets the tone for this restaurant/bar.

On to the edibles. The drinks are meticulously crafted, with interesting ingredients, and very delicious. I can just keep trying all their different cocktails all night long. The drinks all have funny names -- the Chinese words are more like nonsense. Translated back to English, you get gems like "Tastes like biscuits", "Smells like grandma", or "Nut for you".

We ordered quite a few finger foods to share as well. There's the trick dog (their own ground hot dogs in a bun), the homemade chicken nuggets, the animal style fries. It seems like they decided not to pound all their minced meats to a paste to retain texture -- because both the hot dog and the chicken nuggets tasted as such. The sauces were the highlight on all the items, as was the presentation -- chinese dipping bowls, etc... brings it closer to the theme.

This is a fun bar to be at, and a delicious one too. The only downside is that it gets really, really crowded. Maybe I should try to actually dine there upstairs some time to get away from the crowds -- but then the crowds will occasionally stare at you. Would it be too creepy?
author: Alice C.

description:
THE NEW WEDNESDATES
(5 stars)

Spread it open, let it ooze out, and eat it. SCOTCH EGG HAD ME AT HELLO!

- FOOD, simple and delicious
- PRICES, decent
- SERVICE, very good
- AMBIANCE, bar downstairs/tiny restaurant upstairs. the concept is simple and creative. 

Great company, great conversations, clinging of drinks, and endless laughter is what I look forward to after work the past several Wednesdays. And Wednesday was soon here again. We came here hunting for new palate experiences because that is how we roll through the concrete jungles. Knowing me, I will go lengths to experience something new, something yet not discovered by the masses, something unique that will draw you back for more, and something where I can attempt to replicate in my own kitchen.  Their concepts and creativity makes me like this place even more. The drink menu was a book of records and each record was a drink. Good vibe, good music, good crowd, good food. I've been "domesticated" every Wednesday for the past 1.4 years, my friends have said I've been liberated from a deadbeat loser with no future going for himself.

HEFFER STATUS.

LINDA RONSTADT HEAT WAVE ($10) - Hanger one, lillet rose, melleti, galliano, watermelon, and lime. SO YUMMY. Very delicate in taste and has a light herbal and fruit taste. It was was a creeper, hit me like a ton of bricks. Their drinks here are off the chains.

CRACKLINGS ($6) - Pork belly, brown sugar, spice blend. Uhm SPICY. When I choose to eat some kind of meat, it will have to be pork. It was their version of chicharron, it was good but kind of spicy. I liked how it was freshly fried and didn't carry that old grease taste. After about 3-4 crackins, I was over it as the spice just got spicier. Good to share with another person.

KALE SALAD ($9) - Avocado, parmesan, pepitos, slow-cooked egg yolk dressing. This was one of the best kale salads I've ever had in my life. You can trust my opinion on that. It was lightly creamy because of the egg yolk and avocado, easily to take down, and just a healthy kind deliciousness I can't really explain. I can't believe I'm speaking so highly of a kale salad but it was just a great dish. Good to share between 2-3 people.

SCOTCH EGG ($10) - Soft-boiled egg, brandade, beet confit, salmon roe, crème fraiche. WTHeezie.... pretty damn delicious. I will have to say that it kinda is a bit salty, but if you take each bite with a bit of the beet confit (purple stuff) it really balanced everything out and make the dish ten times tastier. I don't think everything on the plate meshed well but the scotch egg with the beet confit go hand and hand. We ordered one for each of us. Oh my, it's a must.

Our bill totaled around $66+. Not bad at all, our bellies left happy.

Will I be back? We want to come back on Wednesdays but we have decided to not get stuck at once great places and keep hunting for more.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
What better bar to hit on Chinese New Year than the one that is decorated somewhat like an ol' dirty Chinese restaurant?*

This was one of the best decisions my brother and I** have ever made. Not only does Trick Dog have some of the best and most interesting cocktails I've had in SF served by perhaps the best bartenders I've had anywhere (shoutout to the talented lady with the pine tree on her forearm), but they went all out for the Lunar New Year:

Twice during our evening, a dancing lion came through and rocked our world, followed closely by ladies distributing lucky red envelopes that contained candy, half dollars, or if you were truly lucky, both.

I was truly lucky. Gung Hay Fat Choy.
_______________

*Not to be confused with the nickname for the Osiris of this rap shit, Roll Fizzlebeef.
**If you are going to go out with someone with the same last name as you, you might want to specify whose tab you want what on, lest you get stuck paying for all the weird shots your brother wants to take.
author: Peter D.

description: Gin Heaven!!! Looking for a quick drink before dinner or even a meet up spot or wanna grab a bite to eat let this be your go to. Bar is very different with a sit down area upstairs to eat from their kitchen. They have so many types of different creative drinks to choose from.
author: Jay S.

description: Great cocktail scene. So many carefully concocted items to choose from. They change their menu a couple times a year. This visit (my first) was all election themed. It was pretty kitchy, but cute, and funny. I loved my drinks. Well balanced, yummy, and definitely boozy! I would 100% come back to imbibe next time I'm in SF.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Im a fan of the Bon Vivant crew. Theyve done drink programs for many good restaurants in SF. Always solid drinks with interesting approaches to the classic cocktail. Recently I went to a party here that was wall to wall people. The Space is basically a long rectangular room with an upstairs having s few tables. Considering the standing room only first floor, the bartenders were on their game and actually got the drinks to us in a timely manner. I asked my bartender to make something of her choice with bourbon, while my friend got the non alcoholic pineapple/coconut selection. Both fairly solid drinks. I wish i was there longer to try a few more but between talking to people i knew all over the room and the parking restrictions we had to adhere to for my friends car, we had to cut out early.

One of my co workers loves the burger here so she keeps telling me i should have it. One day im going to come back on a more normal service and have food plus a few more drinks to see how they usually run. However even with these crowded, busy condition, they delivered a good time. 4.25 stars
author: Kim N.

description:
Ok roll over and play dead now. Good boy! Trick dog is anything but a dog with one or two tricks up its sleeve. This place has everything you could ever want from a city. 

Location is usually key when starting a business and although most businesses in this city thrive off of being on the beaten path, Trick Dog defies with its Portr-ission location. As you walk closer and closer it reminds me of New York City streets with each neighborhood being better than the last. You'll pass old favorites like Comstock and Schmidt's before you'll hit this new favorite.

Once inside you've definitely been transported into another city. The old yet new feel of the decor brings a thought to everyone's mind; we've arrived. The drinks are top-notch while the small beats are pretty damn good too. Check out the fried avocado. Yum.
author: Kevin J.

description: This place is dope - good music & the cocktail menu is amazing! They name every drink after a local graffiti artist! Not too mention tasty and it was pretty crackin on a Tuesday night. Will definetly be back!
author: Julia ..
