description: Good hipster vibe, if you're into that. Expensive drinks, but some really good ones at that. Great location in the Mission and a fun Friday night spot to hang out with friends. Tends be very loud though
author: Aaron T.

description:
My words to my friend as we approached the door, about nearby Flour and Water: "It's really great, but not worth all the hype and the line in the street. I just have no tolerance for the line in the street." One minute later: We have to wait in line to enter Trick Dog. On the street, in the freezing cold. I try to convince my friend to go elsewhere but he really pushes to stay the course.

We were rewarded with a better-than-expected experience once inside the loud and overpacked place.

This is absolutely in my top 2 favorite places to drink right now, and they couldn't have nailed it better with these amazing, creative, well-thought-out cocktails. The small accompanying bar menu is impressive and perfect if you are not vegetarian. If you are vegetarian you probably crave another option or two. I personally covet that kale salad and hope it stays. I did venture to taste my friend's brussels sprouts (with bacon and sunchoke chips) and they were freaking amazing. Crispy and flavorful. A bacon-free option would be great to see. Thoroughly unimpressed with the mushroom hummus.

But oh, back to the cocktails! Worked through these, listed in descending order of preference: St. Elmo's Fire, Gypsy Tan, Straw Hat, Pennies from Heaven, Witchwood. ALL were well-balanced and delicious. I haven't tried the popular Baby Turtle yet. The green chartreuse/chocolate soda hiball is something...to experience. Kind of creepy, yet also delicious...like that weird ex you stayed with too long.

So why not 5 stars? See above. Street line. Often. Also the music is too loud. I feel sorry for the neighbors. And the service is a wee lacking, in that it can take multiple requests for water or a check before it shows. But it's friendly. They'll be seeing a lot of me.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Fun and delicious cocktails. amazing kale salad. Ugh, trick dog, you have ruined me for any other kale salad.
author: Jenny L.

description:
BABY TURTLE!!! my Favorite drink! 

Cracklings were awesome!!! 

This place is definitely a great spot to go for a few drinks and maybe snack here and there. 

As for dinner, I'd suggest you go early and get your name on their list. Seating is very limited.
author: Catherine K.

description: Trick Dog did the trick. Delicious cocktails! Especially the Dragon Gate. The Trick Dog burger was right on! The tomato salad was devine. The entire staff delivered. Cannot wait to return! Five friggin stars...
author: Elizabeth Q.

description:
Great drinks and more great drinks, as well as,  friendly staff and a great location.  Did I say great drinks?  Man, I wish I could make these drinks at home. 

I loved their pantone menu, Alas, it is no longer.  Now they have these albums of record 45s.  While it is not a very effective menu, it is amazing. So fun to look through.  I flagged down a bar back to recommend something similar to the 'straw hat' from the pantone menu days.  He recommended "shes gone".  After a couple of those, so was I. If the drinks were not amazing, the menus would just be gimmicky.  As it is, they go perfectly hand in hand!
author: Francis B.

description:
The Gypsy Tan, with rye and fernet, is the best cocktail I've had in SF.  The Baby Turtle may be a runner-up.  The ambience (lively) and crowd (hip) here are similar to other local cocktail bars, but the drinks stand out.

Curious to go back and see if the food keeps up.
author: Paul K.

description:
The drinks here are solid. A solid place for hand crafted drinks. We came here for Char's bday on a Wednesday for a nightcap.

Pantone:  Almost like a kentucky buck but not really with beets. This drink is delicious and the beets provide all the hang over cure you may potentially get for pounding a bunch of these down. The whiskey/ginger beer and citrus are always a killer combo. The beets add a nice texture/earthiness to the drink (which is complemented by the whiskey),  while the sweetness from the combier and kummel add a nice finish touch. 

I want to eat here... the food looked and smelled good. The other drinks looked interesting, and I am sure they are just as well crafted as the pantone.
author: Marc T.

description: Note to self: When opening a bar, make sure it is literally connected to a super trendy restaurant, and 1/2 a block from another super trendy restaurant.  Name your bar using a double entrendre as manifested by a hot dog made of burger meat (damn it, they tricked me!), name your drinks after astrological signs, and voile I will be rich.
author: Melanie C.

description: get the #11 drink and the baby bok choy with soy glaze. YUM YUM
author: Natalya C.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Drinks are always excellent with unique, one-of-a-kind mixes. Great vibe - off the beaten path, but always full of people. I was most impressed with their Kale Salad - it's to DIE FOR!!! - I enjoy it as a meal in itself, but if you wanna get it as an appetizer it's big enough to share! ; )
author: Mishayla B.

description:
This place is cool, and it has that "you gotta know to know" feel to it. I think it's a San Francisco thing to crave that type of hidden treasure so that you can later brag about it to your friends. SO go ahead, visit, and then brag.

The hot dog is essentially a burger shaped as a hot dog. Pretty flavorful and tasty. 

The pork appetizer thing was taaaassty.

The Pantone was an interesting drink. in fact the whole drink menu looked cool. I'd want to try a few more different tastes.

this is a place I'll want to try again and see what other tasty bites I can get.
author: Shanee B.

description: The workers here suck, rude and inconsiderate. f&*k this place, never coming here again.
author: Q W.

description: Ammaaaaaazing drinks here.  I always get the Scorpio, but the contents escape me right now.  It probably has Ginger beer in it.  The scotch egg, fish tacos, and the kale salad are delicious but of course the scotch egg is the most special treat. The ambiance is crazy crazy loud and you can't hear eachother at all.  Most weeknights it's the startup /tech crowd.
author: Terry K.

description: Best bar in SF (according to James Beard, playboy, countless other news providers and myself). Bartenders are on point and fast as hell. Drinks delicious. Food awesome. Pretty people everywhere all smiling having a great time. What's not to love. Deserve all the accolades.
author: Michael C.

description: Great ambiance and very well thought out mixed drinks. The food has great selection and their trick dog is a must try (big surprise). Definately a place to bring friends to hang out and have a good time.
author: Johanna P.

description:
ok so this definitely isn't my type of place to hang out.  My husband and I usually like dive bar atmospheres better.  Especially since we were visiting San Fran from the Midwest we weren't really stoked when our friend brought us here but I'm glad we stopped in for a few drinks.

First off the bouncer was super nice.  For a Saturday night it was quite busy but we were able to get to the bar a bit and get ahold of a drink menu.

My main reason for giving this place a 5 star review is that the bartender was GREAT!  First off, very talented.  Second of all, he knew his booze.  My husband ordered a brandy ol fashion sweet (midwest drink) and he knew right away where we were from and made an awesome brandy ol fashion sweet.  My friend and I had a few drinks off their drink menu which were both very good and it was fun to try something different.  Obviously a little more pricey then your average mixed drink but well worth it.  The place was getting packed and the bartendar still was very personable and talkative for how busy he was.

Would definitely go back here if we go back to San Fran.  Thanks for a great evening!
author: Jen D.

description: Nice little vintage modern bar~Great drinks! The Mission is really changing~Expect a hipster crowd no one from the hood here! I Would come back for drinks but I'm not feeling the crowd.
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description:
Ok, went back on Weds night, and I'm updating my review to 5 stars. Tried more of their drinks (straw hat, delicious) and tasted the trick dog, thrice cooked fries, and cracklins (ALL DELICIOUS). Trick dog burger was tasty (kinda reminded me of a fancy big mac, but I consider this to be a very good thing), fries were perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the cracklins were dangerously addicting. 

Service was great. We ate the bar and a guy next to us knocked over one of our drinks, shattering the glass and spilling onto our food. Immediately the bartender cleaned up the mess, scooped up our food, and said "the kitchen's on it!." Within minutes, they gave us new drinks and food. It was pretty attractive, I must say.  

Spotted Chef Jonathan Waxman here. If Trick Dog is good enough for him on a late Weds night, it's good enough for me!
author: Susan C.

description:
Easily one of my favorite speakeasies in San Francisco!
My friends and I got here half an hour after opening to get some bar space and were promptly helped.
A couple of notable cocktails were the Vintage Photo, Pennies from Heaven, and Gypsy Tan.
St. Elmo's Fire was also pretty good.

I loved the layout of the bar and the fact that they were open so early!
I'll have to try making reservations sometime to try out their food at the upstairs seating.
author: Christopher S.

description:
My friend wanted to go to a chill bar with cocktails and good food. I found Trick Dog on Yelp, and it might be one of my new favorites. The atmosphere was perfect for us. The building is industrial, which is normal for the neighborhood, and I couldn't really see the sign if there was one but it appeared to be the only bar on that block.

We went on a weekday, so it's hard to tell how packed it gets on weekends. It was busy for a Thursday night, and there was plenty of room to stand, walk around, and even sit (always a plus).

The fact that the menus change in a creative manner was awesome. When we went, the menu was a map with drinks named after places around SF. I recommend the Painted Ladies. Deliciously sweet and refreshing like a mint moquito but less minty. I also had the Golden Fire Hydrant, which was good but not as unique in flavors.

For food, we had the fish tacos and fries (manimal style). Considering how dark it was, we could not figure out what the "manimal" was. Either way, both dishes were awesome. 

I knocked off a star based on service. We rarely saw the waitress before we were seated and while we were eating. Our drink order got lost at some point, and she didn't own up to it so that was a little weird. I'm lenient when it comes to service, and it's a bar/restaurant so I would lower my standards anyway. Getting a drink downstairs wasn't terribly difficult, and that's more important :)

Also, the person that made the menu on their mobile site needs to sell his/her services to every restaurant! It is not just a PDF document!
author: Laura N.

description: Trick Dog is a busy place. You get the sense it's hard on the wait staff. The food is decent and the floor can be packed. We ate and sat upstairs. Aaron was really great.
author: Emil W.

description: Trick dog's atmosphere is awesome. Cozy bar with true mixologists that yield fantastic cocktails. Upstairs is a quaint dining space but worth the wait. The falafel sticks are a pass. But get the kale salad and the shrimp bowl. Delicious.  It's a great place for a casual dinner with friends or for a date.
author: Drew J.

description: I'm from San Jose, so the concept of the SF bar/restaurant combo thing is new to me.  This place has a great vibe as soon as you walk in, it has separate seating upstairs which I loved because we came more for the food than for the bar.  The service was great, the food was tasty, and the crowd was lively. I had the trick dog and manimal fries.
author: Danny Z.

description: I am so lucky to have this as my neighborhood local.  The cocktails are outstanding, and I absolutely love eating upstairs.  The kale salad is a must,  as are the fries and burger.  I honestly have never had a bad meal here, and it's my favorite place to take friends who are visiting.
author: Alisha A.

description: Fantastic drinks - truly inspirational, eclectic and just good. Very creative. Food was quite good as well. I enjoyed the rice plate and Brussel Sprouts.
author: Victor Z.

description:
Came here at about 12 to 1am, I'm not exactly sure as I was already a bit tipsy.   We sat upstairs and had a really spunky waitress.  I didn't think this place was pretentious at all, like some of the other reviews say.  

We had pretty much every appetizer on the menu.  Everything was good, but the cracklin pork thingies were mind bottling good.  I may have to revise the rating when I come here sober, but I remember literally saying WOW after I ate the pork skin. There are very few WOW food moments that I can recall in the past few years, which is why I'm giving this place 5 stars.
author: Sammy L.

description:
Any bar that is versatile enough to be great for a nice date or for watching the superbowl deserves an honorable mention! Airy, sunny and a little industrial feel during the day, dark and cozy atmosphere at night. It's not a large space, but still feels pretty open.The upstairs loft has a bunch of tables for a nicer sit-down drinks and snacks experience.
The best part is of course the cocktails! I've tried the Pantone, Gypsy Tan, Pennies from Heaven and Night Moves (not many places do a good drink with coffee flavor!) and they were all really well-balanced and delicious. The bartenders are friendly and skilled-despite a lack of suspenders or carefully sculpted hipster facial hair.
The food is also definitely worth trying-particularly the scotch egg and the brussel sprouts.
author: Alex Z.

description:
If you are in your mid-30s to mid-40s, like to fold your trousers, wear suspenders, chuck Taylors and a fedora - you have found your bar.

Now, the reason for my rating is not the drinks or food. It's the crowd and the ridiculous amount of time it takes to get a drink when busy (which is literally every evening).

IF you are considering going here, I would suggest you go early and leave early. If you do that, you are actually treated to being able to get drinks from knowledgable bartenders (who take their mixing seriously) and good food (if you eat upstairs). The dish that stood out in my mind for some reason was the simple but delicious kale and avocado salad. The drink menu is top notch.
author: Vijay S.

description: Slow service but yummy cocktails (loved Capricorn) and possibly the best fries I've ever had in my life. The trick dog was good too. They were out of kale salad - but would def come back to try it!
author: Miri Kwon R.

description: cocktails are amazing! I plan to come back the next time I'm in the area. Located in the perfect spot!
author: Jeri M.

description: My friend said "The kale salad at Trick Dog will change your life!" She wasn't kidding. I just woke up after having dinner at Trick Dog last night, and I'm already thinking about when I can go back there to EAT KALE again! The tomato/burrata salad was also ahhhmazing! We didn't love our third item, but when we mentioned it to the staff, they were quick to fix the problem way beyond our expectations. I will definitely be back. p.s. I'm gluten-free and had no trouble ordering off their menu :)
author: Sally M.

description: Great little spot. All the bites we ordered got raves and the drinks were good. Love this little area of 20th Street and all the options available.  Be sure to check their namesake (the Trick Dog).  Cute.
author: Robert M.

description: It's just a drink, why is it so expensive.  Just think about that for a moment.  3 rounds for 2 people shouldn't run a person $70.  Obviously this isn't the only bar in town with that hip mixology vibe, but don't you think we've experienced enough of this?  Anyway, they are just drinks...I'd be hard pressed to believe you can tell the difference between the hipster infused gibberish here vs Beretta vs Local Edition vs The Armory Bar vs [name your awesome glacier water infused vodka location].  The vibe is chill, but the area obviously is very local, so if you want to go somewhere else you'll be driving.  I'd be back if I got a bonus check at work, and want a place that's relatively quiet and you can talk to a friend.
author: A A.

description: Inventive drinks, great atmosphere, yummy food menu. This is a great place to stop by for a drink and a snack to treat yourself!
author: Turi F.

description: I really enjoy this bar for a fun girls night out in the mission. The downstairs bar is always crowded but in a good way, full of people but everyone's friendly and not too drunk. The wait for dinner upstairs is really long (2 hour wait on a Saturday night) but if you're willing to hang around and grab drinks downstairs it's worth it. The kale salad is big enough to feed a small army. The trick dog is a must have. I didn't think I'd like the shrimp noodles since I'm not a shrimp fan, but was really glad I got them. Very reminiscent of chubby noodle in north beach and the marina. The flavor of the noodles was phenomenal with just the right amount of spice. The chicken nuggets are ehhhhhhh at best. I think the drinks are overpriced for what they are and definitely not the best I've had, but overall price of food is decent and the quality/service is good.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Went with 2 friends on a Wednesday night, crowded but not unbearable. The bartenders are fast and friendly and the drinks were interesting and delicious... Pennies from heaven, baby turtle were stand outs.  We waited to grab a table to eat, about 40 minutes, goes by fast when you have a little buzzzz ;)
Food was very good as well.  Great prices, trick dog is the way to go, also shrimp cocktail, pimento cheese dip and ovaltine ice cream. Can't wait to go back.
author: Nicole q.

description: The service upstairs is unbelievably bad. The waitress treated us as if she was doing us a favor.
author: Kam Z.

description: When we went there, we had to wait a bit for the service and also the food took a little longer to arrive. I highly recommend the Trick Dog, a hamburger in a hot dog bun. Great sauce and perfect taste. Still it is a bit small and you should get fries or something else on the side.
author: Freddy E.

description:
The food was outstanding.  Would go back again but not a friday nght at 6.   Noise level a little high for me.
LindaT
author: Linda T.

description: Great bar and great service for a super busy Friday night. Went out of the way to accomodate a drink order that wasn't listed. A very cool establishment in a trendy area.
author: Livia M.

description: They changed their cocktail menu to a San Francisco map theme. Get the Sutro Baths. Three types of rum with grapefruit, lime and Sightglass coffee. I swear, you will want to just *live* in it.
author: Auburn S.

description: Gah this place was amazing - a hot little dollop of NY in SF with minimal pretension. We broke out laughing when a kale salad arrived that was about the size of our three heads put together - but then stopped when we finished the entire plate within minutes and realized we wanted more. Scotch egg, steak tartare- perfect. For cocktails, we tried the Leo, the Libra, the Taurus and the Scorpio... all intriguing, strange and delicious. The only minor fail was the panna cotta at the end, but by then we were so happy it was all good.
author: Crystal W.

description: Delicious cocktails with friendly, attentive servers. I loved the tequila with coconut drink...served in a ceramic pineapple type of mug and not a drink you will swallow in 3 sips...substantial..worth the price
author: First L.

description: The funniest menu I've ever seen, plus the best cooked simple food. The wait staff are a delight and are worth going back just to keep up with them. Great drinks, solid crowd. 10/10.
author: Harrison N.

description: My favorite place for cocktails. we usually arrive early when they open and have a couple of high end, delicious, perfectly crafted cocktails before a nice dinner at one of our other favorite spots in the Mission. The best Sazerac this side of the Mississippi!!!
author: Madeleine S.

description:
This is a drinking place -- an exciting addition to this restaurant row area; Trick Dog is a great old industrial design two-level bar, upstairs a sit-down area with table service; downstairs where it's all happening.  The Bon Vivants know their cocktails, and the Pantone cocktail is perfected down to a science (with freshly extracted beet juice) and tasty small plates.

The bar was buzzing with small groups of friends so we did the seating area upstairs, and better for conversation.
author: Susan S.

description: Food and drinks were great, service was quite prompt. Only reason this review lost its stars was because of some confusion between whether we could put our bags away in a storage area. Told by one employee we could, then rudely berated by another for doing so. Great food and drinks doesn't get you the best rating, service does, sorry.
author: Don H.

description: My boyfriend took me here on a random Friday night because he thought I would enjoy the Scotch Egg (I thought I would enjoy it too). We got here relatively early, around 6:30? The bar area was already extremely crowded, but the dining area is upstairs. It's pretty small though. Fits probably 20 people MAX. It's also really loud since its right above the bar, so really hard to talk to. Not really good for date night, unless you don't want to talk to your date. Anyway, we ordered the Trick Dog, Thrice cooked Fries Manimal Style, and the Scotch Egg. The Trick Dog was surprisingly very good and flavorful, so were the fries. Only thing that disappointed me was the Scotch Egg.. We also ordered drinks, but they were just okay. I didn't really like them.
author: Lina C.

description:
Came here for drinks on a Friday night and it was crowded and expensive at $12 per cocktail but otherwise awesome. The bartenders have got skills and they have 12 awesome, totally different types. The bartenders move really quickly and are always looking out for new orders but it does take awhile to get a drink because of the crowd. 

Great to start the night and have tasty cocktails.
author: Ojus P.

description: 1 can of apple cider + 1 bottled beer = 16$. It's pricey and its trendy - but well crafted drinks. It's hard to get a seat as well.  Young well dressed good looking crowd. Will I go back - yes because of their kale salad that I can't find anywhere and it's out of this world delicious ( even tho I m not a huge fan of kale)
author: Zita M.

description: Had a wonderful birthday dinner here. We ordered every single dish and the notable ones are french fries, fig dish, kale salad and the trick dog. Almost all the cocktail was good but I think my favorite was the mission and dolores (might be because I live here!) Anyways, props for the good food and cocktail!
author: George L.

description: Fabulous lighting, excellent drinks -- one star down for not having enough spots to sit if you just wanna sip and munch on starters.
author: Denise M.

description: From the Pantone color wheel drink menu to a space that has garnered attention from the Chronicle's style section, and of course drinks that have been crafted with as much attention as the space... this place it a must try. It is my go to for cocktails. The deal was sealed when I saw "Grandma's Sweater" on the menu. Please don't ever change.
author: Al L.

description: dark, hip and mission...upstairs for dining...table for six...drinks and food...browsing menu and making a plan to share...menu cards fan out...bit cumbersome looking...round of drinks first...a pleasant surprise of free food...seasoned hamburger in a hot dog bun...simple lettuce, pickle and thousand island type "special" saucing...good and was considering ordering, but randomly given free...wrong order from another table?...order of potato fries crisp outer and super soft mash center...dip and consume fabulous...kale salad lightly creamy texture, but a clean and crisp taste wonderful..kale salad is the everyday favorite..vietnamese style rice plate is fabulous and great...crispy rice, lemongrass pork, pickled radish and carrots, and wedge of lime...spread of mustard seeds a perfect compliment...well presented and flavors and textures working in harmony....mostly all under $ten or slightly over....scorpio the current favorite drink...skip the very salty scotch eggs...drinks or bites large enough to share....great location for good food, good drinks...
author: Hen A.

description: Creative drinks made in front of you by a bartender who knows what he's doing.  A large selection of uncommon spirits, cool industrial atmosphere and background music that's quiet enough to talk over.  Worth a trip to the mission.
author: James B.

description: I've never eaten at this place so just reviewing the bar, but I love the atmosphere here. Fun, young, hipster vibe. They also have a great cocktail and beer list. It does get a bit loud so it's not a place for romantic conversation. More like a fun, lively place to kick off your night.
author: Kate N.

description: The Libra cocktail I had was pretty much one of the most perfect cocktails I've ever had. Perfect taste, temperature, strength, and finish. Will be coming back again for the food.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
It's been a year since I first wrote about Trick Dog.  Since then I've probably been here about 20 times. It never ceases to amaze me. I remember when they first ditched the famous Pantone styled menu and I thought "well that was a bad idea" How wrong have I been. Every change has been a feast for the eyes and the palette. I look forward to each time the season changes as it brings a new menu design along with a cocktail menu to pair with the time of year. Needless to say every time they make a change it's perfect every time. The thing that impressed me on my last trip is the bartenders.  Not that they never impressed me before but I've never really watched them dealing with customers. I'm pretty easy myself so it went unnoticed but this time I was at the end where I just happened to notice the back and forth between bartender and customer. It's amazing how well they all. (and I mean all of them) deal with the chaos of the bar along with mixing each drink with care and passion. It's an amazing to watch. The food has been spot on as usual during my trips and a number of the staff surprisingly remember me every time I'm there. 

I can't say enough amazing things about Trick Dog it simp.... wait I don't want to have to wait for drinks or deal with a line.  Don't go here it's not what you think! disregard what I am writing it's.... I can't lie, It's the best bar I've ever stepped foot in.
author: Joco F.

description: Good place! I love cocktails with egg white, which give that nice, creamy, foaminess. So I very much enjoyed the January cocktail (Jameson, vanilla, lemon, white sage, etc.)! I also love smooth, caramel-y bourbon cocktails, so the November concoction (pear&pean vermouth, bitters, etc.) was great as well!
author: Riz W.

description: This place, what can I say?, I'm here pretty regularly and there is a reason, atmosphere, friendly staff, nice little bar snack menu, and the drinks are very good.  I'd say that the staff is pretty outstanding not only are they pretty but they are also outstanding :)  I feel like the menu is pretty original and I even like the location, I like that it's tucked away. Over all such a chill cool place to hang out, check it out
author: Joonier Y.

description: Great drink menu with cocktails that pack in a lot of flavor and a lot of booze. The menu also offer small bar bites. I tried the popular scotch egg, and appreciated the different textures.
author: C K.

description: Loved TD when it first opened, now that everyone else has found it, it's become a scene. Keep in mind the decibel level is so loud that you'll never be able to have any sort of conversation with your friends or dates, because everyone else around you is screaming to be heard too! The long wait for cocktails at the bar doesn't make it worth the visit either. Only recommendation is to be the first to arrive & miss the crowds.
author: hot t.

description: Really good cocktails while watching the Mission hipsters mingle with each other.  I will definitely be back to try the food.
author: Fatty A.

description: Didnt get to stay long. But I was greeted openly. It's an bar with an open space. Really friendly crowd and vibe from young professionals. Check it out
author: Kay G.

description: A bunch of us were at Trick Dog the other night and really liked the vibe. The drinks are excellent and the crowd is hard with a stylish edge. I wanted to give a good review but one of my friends with whom I was there the other night sent me a link to the 7 by 7 article and I and he were both so turned off. The scene at Trick Dog is branded so intentionally to be chill, solid and indie and yet that guy is such a whiner. Chefs are cool in part bc they do not whine, about anything...ever and that guy actually whined like a kid on the play ground that had the red ball taken from him. Something isnt right with that Fabio looking guy. Bad taste in the Boca.
author: Kate S.

description: Really slow service. Unpersonable. They say three of us at a two-top despite open tables throughout.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
My review is strictly based on their food menu because I don't drink.

Came here with my friend on a week night and looked around and didn't find anything regarding a wait list so we went upstairs where the seating area is and we were told by a server that it would be about a 40 minute wait even though we didn't see a wait list anywhere. Anyways, we didn't mind the wait so we went back downstairs and my friend ordered drinks while we waited to be called. Some time goes by (I didn't bother to check the time but it didn't feel like 40 minutes) and we were called for our table and we follow our server upstairs.

We ordered the Trick Dog and split Manimal style fries. The Trick Dog is pretty good but I think I've had better burgers. The closest thing I can liken it to is a superior version of the Big Mac; better meat, better cooked, better bun, better sauce but the flavor profile is more or less the same as a Big Mac. I don't mean it as an insult by any means but it's the closest thing that comes to mind.

The Manimal style fries were really good, it had a mayo-based sauce that seems to have paprika and chili powder mixed in for a slight kick but not enough for it to be a significant with an added either lobster or crab flavor in there somehow. Whatever the case may be, they were really good, I definitely recommend them.

I ordered a root beer as well and it was underwhelming. Maybe I was expecting something with more spice or a kick to it but this one just fell flat; it left a very bland aftertaste. It was definitely drinkable but I was expecting something more than a generic root beer taste.

Over all, I enjoyed my experience here but perhaps my expectation was more than it should have been leaving me with wanting more.
author: Richard C.

description: Walked in and stood at the bar for 28 minutes and was never once acknowledged by the staff. Yes it was busy but people that came in 15-20 minutes after us were served before us. Waited patiently and respectfully trying to get a bartender's attention, but got me nowhere. Really disappointing. Walked out. Won't be back.
author: Geoff W.

description: I think I found my most favorite bar in the world. I came across an article on the opening of this place last year and kept the unforgettable name in my memory bank as I knew I'd someday find myself in SF. It truly was the most unique dinning experience we had in a very long time. The bar dstairs is hopping while you wait 45-1h for a table upstairs which is a tiny dinning room of maybe 5 or 6 tables. The mountainous kale salad was a great way to start and our entrees, mine the Trick Dog, a sandwich of pure goodness my date's beef "tartare" was superb. However, what made the whole experience so unique was the hand crafted cocktails which were displayed on 45"s in a record album.
author: Mike D.

description: The Pantone menu was inspired... Had a gypsy tan, which was fantastic. Would've been content to have a great many more drinks and food from their well developed and immensely varied offerings, had my time and available spending allowed. It's on the pricey side- but that's standard fare and what you can expect to pay when it comes to mixology.
author: Jeffrey K.

description: Best food I've ever had and I'm not exaggerating. I'm visiting from San Diego and have travelled all over and this is hands down the Best. Food. Ever. I was blessed to sample basically the entire menu and it was all Amazing. Reasonably priced, perfect portions. Great drinks too. The tomato salad was delicious and light, the Trick Dog was scrumptious and savory. And everything else was perfect too. The ceviche was light and flavorful too. Oh, and the Thrice Fries... Best fries ever.
author: Heather D.

description: dogs r so cute! it was the doggie theme menu when i went with my boyfriend. they had nice cups for cocktails. we drank a bit at the bar then he surprised me an we went upstairs. he ordered like the whole menu for me because i was saying how hungry i was from walking aroun all day. the portions were big too! the servers were real nice and friendly, and it was so intimate eating dinner on the upper level. we were close to other people at their tables 2, but it was totally ok cuz i was in my own food-world. so for you guys eating here i have one word for you to not forget - MANIMAL FRIES!
author: Sweetie S.

description: Did not completely understand what kind of place it is. Drinks were really good, doorman and other staff was friendly and funny. Just nothing else to say about here, I felt like it was not my place, I felt  like an alien.  It might be because of the other people.
author: Kelly R.

description: The atmosphere was great, but the food was not edible. I had the pulled pork tacos and my husband had the lamb. We only ate a few bites. They do fundraise for an animal shelter, which is a plus. Next time I would stop for drinks in a fun, hip atmosphere, but skip the food!
author: Teresa M.

description: Amazing cocktail menu. Really cool spot in the heart of the mission. The whole neighboord has a cool edgy vibe. This place is awesome - two floors but still feels intimate and swanky. The menu is awesome, all based off of the San Fran. I would highly recommend to anybody who wants a "local experience".
author: Barbara T.

description: 4.5 stars.  Didn't eat here, just came here on a Saturday night to get some drinks.  We got there and there was a line to get in.  It's a very small space, so we waited for quite a while.  The bouncer eventually let us in.  Nice guy... wasn't a tough and mean bouncer.. but a nice hipster bouncer.  Definitely hipster inside.  Not many places to stand or hang out, so we went to the back alley way between the bar and the restaurant next door.  Even though we were in the way of some servers and guys getting ice and stuff, they never said anything to us or told us to move.  Even though it was packed, it was relatively easy to get a drink.  The drink menu was too much to peruse, so I just kept the drinks easy.. maybe that's why there were so cheap.  Bought 2 drinks twice, and each time it was like 10 or 12 bucks.  Crowded, but relaxed and easy.  Loud but not super loud.
author: Easter E.

description: Check your credit card statement if you visit this place.  One of the bartenders takes the liberty of padding their wallet by adding a few dollars to your check.
author: J C.

description:
I've been eagerly waiting for this bar to open since hearing about it over a year ago. Dropped in on opening night and immediately felt like I'd been here all my life. The ambiance of the place is reminiscent of times past where welcoming one with gracious warmth and hospitality was the standard. The lighting was perfect and the funk they were playing was catchy and smooth. It's obvious these boys did their homework and knew exactly what they wanted you to feel.
The place was filling up fast so my friend and I stepped over to the bar and took a look at the drink menu. Now when I first saw the menu on the bar I though for sure it was a paint matching deck that one of the painters had absentmindedly left behind. And when I commented to my friend as such she said, no I believe that's the drink menu. Upon further inspection I realized that indeed it was the drink menu. Wow, the Bon Vivants really went outside the box with this one. But I shouldn't expect less from these guys. The menu was great being made to be a Pantone swatch book with one cocktail per page. Being a lover of the agave I opted for the "Baby Turtle" first with is Tequila Ocho (one of my faves), Campari, grapefruit, cinnamon and lime. My friend had the Paper Moon made with Hangar 1 Vodka (another fave) some house made concoction and lime. We watched the bartender craft each cocktail in these really cool looking industrial beakers. He seemed to know exactly what he was doing and although very busy was acknowledging everyone with a smile and a greeting. It seemed there were a few "industry folks" in there despite the early hour. Maybe it's a Monday thing and the pros are off work. Anyways he served us our cocktails in some very cool looking glassware and lo and behold the drinks were delicious. The Bay Turtle was balanced with equal bitterness and that fruity agave taste that I crave. My friend was equally blown away with the Paper Moon. We switched cocktails and both agreed they were delicious. I could have finished hers but I wanted my agave back.
We decided to get a bite since neither of us were going to be leaving for a while so after perusing the menu (seems like a good selection of bar food that would not be out of place in any high end restaurant). I spied the Scotch Egg and the Sweetie McNuggets and knew I had to try them both. Oh My god I wasn't disappointed. Now I haven't seen a Scotch Egg on a menu in a very long time and I've probably only had one once in my life and if you don't know what it is, Google it. The way Trick Dog does it is a semi hard boiled egg (yolk is still slightly runny) wrapped in Brandade and fried. SERIOUSLY NOW. Amazing. I want to get two with some bread and make the mother of all sandwiches. But that's just me. And the Sweetie McNuggets are deep fried breaded sweetbreads. Once again BLOWN AWAY. Since we were doing so much fried food and the diet had completely gone out the door we decided to go healthy and ordered the Kale salad to balance it out. That too was delicious with bits of avocado and grated cheese and just perfectly dressed. I could've had two of everything.
At this point things were starting to get very busy and we were getting buzzed having also tried Grandma's Sweater and a Polar Bear. Both of which were stellar gin and mescal cocktails respectively also expertly made. After having a few shots of tequila things started to get fuzzy so we paid our bill, thanked our bartender and started to head towards the door. At least 4 members of the staff said good bye and thanked us on our way out once again showing that warmth and hospitality feeling I had spoken about earlier. What a breath of fresh air this place is. I went back on Thursday and had a similar experience. I'll be back again soon to try out some of the other dishes and cocktails. I'll keep you posted. Thank you Trick Dog.
author: Bill H.

description:
oooooooooh my.

i was recommended this one drink.
and at first i was like okkkkkkkkkkkk uhm wierd.
but then i was like i love bourbon! 
and i love beet juice.
but bourbon AND beet juice?!?

ok lets try this.

and it was amazing.

someone also ordered the pork rinds. pretty sure half of them disappeared into my mouth. ooops. it was worth it.

this is a craft cocktail bar, that for sure has the craft.
author: Chira V.

description:
Trick Dog is a good place to go to watch both classic and inventive cocktails being made, while you sip on your very own. The service has always been very attentive and friendly, even when we went in looking kinda scrubby and not-so-trendy-hipster. It's also in a very cool area of the Mission - surrounded by some down and out areas, it's a bit of a diamond in the rough. Clean and trendy with a hint of SoMa modernism. Trick Dog is right next to flour+water, so it's an ideal spot to have a pre-dinner cocktail. 

The only downsides to Trick Dog would be the seating. They've got bar seating up against the bar (obviously), as well as bar seating against the adjacent wall. The rest is just standing room. I really wish the upstairs seating section was for bar patrons, and not just for people ordering some small fare after 5 pm. I generally don't like to stand for an extended period of time with a little fancy glass filled with nectar of the gods. After my first drink, I'd like to take a seat with my second one and spend some quality time instagramming it, not to mention being able to give the dogs a bit of a rest.
author: Matt S.

description:
We went here for Happy Hour (around 5:00 PM) on a Friday because we had repeatedly heard that it was "the best bar in San Francisco." I liked it, and can't think of a better bar in SF off the top of my head, but I wasn't blown away. The vibe in the small industrial-warehouse-turned-bar was good but not great. I actually found the music odd (country). There are is also very little seating, which I assume makes sense when the place is more busy. Finally, every drink is at least $12, and in most cases have less tha 8 oz of liquid.

With all that griping out of the way, I will say that the drinks are pretty darn awesome. I had the Evil Woman, which is probably the most interesting drink of my life. I never would have thought Chile Liqueur would work in a drink, but it was great. My wife's drink also really good.

All in all, I'll probably go back here if invited by a friend, but can't imagine myself suggesting it to friends for a night out drinking. It would just be too darn expensive, and I'm not made of money.
author: Tom H.

description: This place is a crowded mess. It's difficult to get a drink and not a lot of opportunities to sit or get out of other people's way if you don't have a table. We got a group together and got a table upstairs. The service was excellent. The food and the weird menu were not great. Cottage cheese with peaches? Sounds weird, but it was good, but also totally not worth what they charge for it. Same for the kale salad. Drinks are pretty dope, but not worth the hassle.
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
The bartenders here are mixologists - I am talking infusions, twists and tinctures. If your thing is scotch straight up they will have pretty much what you want; but if you like something that has to be concocted, this is your place. I didn't know until recently they served food too, and it's first rate. To be clear, drinks are why people come but I think the food alone would be worth a visit.
The only caveat about this place is that it's trendier than me (I am past the time when I was willing to stand in line to get into a bar) and that it can get really noisy.
author: D Z.

description: I was excited to try Trick Dog, having read the fawning reviews. We made it in early on the first Friday evening. It might be a fine bar if you get there at opening time and snag a bar stool. Otherwise there is no way to get the attention of the staff. Like one of the other reviewers here, we waited a good half hour, talked to various people, tried jumping up and down ... nothing worked. It was clearly hopeless: once people are sitting at the bar, there's no way they're going to leave until they're through with dinner and several drinks. Ideas for the management: either get rid of the bar stools so people will move around and customers can get up to the bar to order eventually, or add table seating and servers.
author: Susan G.

description: Excellent little spot in Mission/Potrero.  Nice ambience, cool menus, and supposedly delicious drinks (I wouldn't know...I'm a teetotaler these days).  It gets busy at around 6:00pm and doesn't have a ton of seating.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Michael G.

description: Love this place! Cocktail menu is amazing. If you eat you have to try the cracklins'.
author: Danny C.

description: Solid place.  Bartenders are nice, cocktails are yummy and change frequently.  If you are a cocktail person that likes to go try out new concoctions with your friends like we do, give this place a whirl.  Their munchies are good too if you want a snack.
author: Suz L.

description:
all the food we had was pretty good, but just barely good enough to want to go back for (i don't typically go for heavy rich foods)

cauliflower - the best dish we had; the brown butter puree...so good
kale salad - surprisingly good
beef tartare - pretty good i guess but overhyped
trick dog - pretty tasty, but i don't think i'd get it again.  the meat was good but i think for a burger i'd prefer not a hot dog bun
manimal fries - pretty good

it's loud, so be prepared to yell at your friends
author: Jeffry C.

description: Might be the best drinks and bartenders in SF (Tradition is runner up). The food is phenomenal too.
author: Deepak J.

description:
Happened into this bar while waiting on a table at Central Kitchen. I had no idea of the name at the time. No sign which is weird and silly. Good drinks (even the egg white one) and a fantastic atmosphere. I love the industrial design. At some point we went out to smoke, and had a lovely chat with the doorman. Despite other reviews, he was very nice and did not give us any issues coming in and out. The bar area is small and was crowded as expected on a Saturday night, but we still enjoyed it.
Downside of this place is they are cool and they know it. The bartender was excellent at preparing our drinks, but was visibly annoyed when we did not order them according to their "album name." Now about those albums..... Apparently Trick Dog is known for their creative ways of presenting the menu and we were there during the time that the menu was a book of 45's. This seriously sucked for a couple of reasons. It's pretty dark in there. Very hard to read the labels on a 45 in the dark. Song titles on a 45 are small, now make them a title plus recipe. Impossible. Then the albums kept falling out when you tried to turn the page. Very glad to hear they have since come up with a new menu design.
Overall, Trick Dog has good drinks (although pricey) and great ambiance which is what one looks for in a bar. However, I must remove a star for pretentiousness. Being a cool bar does not mean you should give the customers attitude and a difficult menu. Get over yourself and just be great.
author: Rachel D.

description: Bartenders were great!!! Drinks amazing! !!!cute location ! Loved the map of the city and the theme. Will be back soon.
author: Kris F.

description: Trick Dog is definitely a fun place. I love that their drink menu is presented via dog calendar-- I got the tropical February, and it was delish. It's too bad that their dinner seating area is so small--they were so popular that night that there was quite the wait. The food itself was pretty tasty-- the Kale Salad I ordered was mountain-sized! The bartenders and servers rocked--they gave us a couple of free shots to celebrate my friend's bachelorette party, which was really sweet. I'm glad I gave them a try, and I'd go again.
author: Christina L.

description:
Experimental cocktails.  Good crowd.  But man, trying to get a drink takes forever.  

If you want to try some of their specialty cocktails, be prepared to wait or ruthlessly grab the attention of the bartender.  I waited for about 15 minutes till I got the drink.  The wait's party due to the large number of people there but mostly because some drinks take forever to make.  I was looking to get a Baby Turtle but it apparently takes about 5-10 minutes to make so I settled for a lime concoction. Luckily, the crowd is great and pretty good at striking random conversations.

Come here if you want to try something different--not all the time, but for some special, spontaneous occasion.  Cocktails are expensive, but they're one-of-a-kind, and the ambiance is pretty slick--exactly what a yuppy would like I suppose.
author: Chris E.

description: I'm so incredibly lucky to live around the corner from Trick Dog.  The bartenders are top notch, the drink recipes exquisite, and persona teeming with individuality.  I never succumbed to the fruity 'girly' drinks until I started browsing their fantastic concoctions.  To test the limits of your self-control, try an "Eye of the Tiger" or "That's All Right".  You'll be hard-pressed not to suck down 3 of them in an hour.  It's all I can do to not empty my bank account here and succumb to raging alcoholism.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Located around the block from Flour+Water you will spot it because of the line wrapped outside this otherwise lonely street. These people are waiting because the cocktails are really good. I tried the list and nearly everyone of them is delicous, everyone one of them balanced.
author: Marcus F.

description: Order off the cocktail menu or have one of the expert bartenders create a cocktail for you.
author: Ted H.

description:
pro - great price, value, awesome drinks and food, really creative

con - hipsters, they're everywhere, but that's like complaining about pigeons in the park
author: Jennifer L.

description: 5 stars for the burger alone, fennel salad was damn good too... Great little place.
author: Wen B.

description: Decent enough bar. I had beers, so I can't comment on the mixed drinks, but I liked the atmosphere. They wouldn't let me in for 5 minutes because they said they were "at capacity," so that was annoying. But, overall, it was decent.
author: Ryan S.

description: I'm obsessed. It makes me feel like a hipster when I am far from one. Such good people watching and really great drinks. Love the astrological sign theme going on, I had the Capricorn and Virgo. Next time I'll try the food, I am super curious about the Trick Dog. Perfectly hipster Valentine's Day
author: Sonya S.

description: Once again, the guys from Bon Vivant absolutely kill it with the drinks menu....Super creative cocktails, and even more funky and awesome how they lay out the menu itself: this time it's an astrology chart. My first-go on this menu, I had the Capricorn (Bourbon, Dubonnet, Curacao, Cynar, Cacao, Rosemary) and it was outstanding and unexpected. Going back for more "signs" soon...
author: Alexis O.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night to see what all the fuss was about. Cocktails were fun and tasty but either I'm an alcoholic or there wasn't any booze in them. To make up for this, we ordered some boiler makers.

Food was good and portions were a lot bigger than I had initially thought. We ordered 6 dishes and 3 came out within 10 minutes. Our next 3 didn't come out until 45 minutes later after repeated "Do you have more food coming?" by 3 different waitresses -- safe to assume they forgot the rest of the food.

Had the fish tacos, trick dog, manimal fries, scotch egg, cauliflower, buffalo chicken. 


I also had multiple waiter's butts rub and bump against me as they tended the party next to our table. At one point, a butt bump was able to physically move my whole body and all I got from the waiter was a pat on the shoulder, no 'excuse me' what-so-ever.

All-in-all, fun place with decent food. I probably won't be back though.
author: Tony H.

description: Caitlin rules. All I have to say! Oh ya. And the drinks are beyond yummy. Walked quite a few blocks to find this place and on a Sunday night it was busier than most places on a Saturday. Definitely recommend this joint!
author: Kami C.

description: One of the better bars in the bay area. Drinks are innovative and delicious. A tad on the expensive side, but definitely beats those disgusting long islands and AMFs. Will come here any day of the week over those other disgusting bars on Polk St and the Mission.
author: Justin L.

description: This spot features some of the best cocktails in town. Even the simple drinks are excellent. I will never pass up a stop at this place. Don't go anywhere and don't change a thing.
author: Greg B.

description:
My two female companions and I couldn't settle on one main course each from all the tasties on the diverse Trick Dog menu, so we ended up splitting the kale salad, rice plate, and curried cauliflower steaks. The verdict: HOLY YUM! In order of favorites, the cauliflower was the winner - that brown butter puree ladled on top is simply sinly - but the kale salad was a seriously close second (what with the unique egg yolk dressing, ample avocado and pepitos, and good-quality parmesan, it ain't no ordinary salad, that's for sure). We were too full for dessert, unfortunately, but I suppose that could also be a good sign that there food is fabulous. Oh, hold on, I can't forget to mention the rice plate: This dish was actually a nice sunrise; I was expecting your run-of-the-mill fried rice, but this rice was super special.. It came in the shape of a small brick, and it was super crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I like a good yin-yang like that ;-) On top of the good food, I recommend Trick Dog for it's ambiance: the loft-style windows in the upstairs dining area are awesome, and they play legit music. 

Side note: If you go to Trick Dog before 7pm, pop into the Salumeria deli and larder next door: they have some fabulous, upscale food to buy, and my adorable friend, Maddie, works there, so shoot her a smile!.
author: Hannah C.

description:
great drinks, great food and great vibe. i went early on a saturday night and was able to get a table upstairs to get food with some friends. we tried a bunch of different things on the menu but the fries were my favorite. I don't know what they did to those fries, but they were amaze. (I eat a lot of french fries so I feel like i am an expert when it comes to this). 

After we ate we when downstairs and hung out and got some more drinks down there. The baby turtle was my favorite. I also really enjoyed going up to the bar and ordering "2 baby turtles" 

i also really liked how they kept people waiting in line outside so it wasn't too crowded and uncomfortable inside. 

i really loved this place and can't wait to go back.
author: Annie W.

description: Follow your phone GPS - no sign on door. If you arrive on open at 3 be aware that food doesn't start until 5 - not sure why but at least staff are kind enough to let you know you can order from Salumeria next door. Staff take a while to warm up but are lovely once they get going. Cocktails excellent with interesting mixes of flavors.  Everyone seems quite unsure of themselves and the bar initially but only takes one cocktail for everyone to loosen up.
author: Ben G.

description: Every drink Caitlin makes is amazing! Staff is very personable and friendly even during the busiest times. I haven't tried the food but can't wait.
author: Sarah C.

description: If you appreciate a well crafted cocktail, this is one of the places to go. You know you're at a legit place if bartenders can make a drink for you on the fly to your liking.  It's a great place for you to unwind over an excellent cocktail.  My fave at the moment is evil woman, but all their drinks are pretty solid.  Scotch egg does serve as a fab addition if you're yearning for some bites.
author: J L.

description:
i've stopped through a few times now, and the drinks are consistently good. they do take a minute to come out, but they're worth the couple-minute-wait. also, the bar food is spot on, these guys know meat (and veggies, that kale salad is YUM). last but not least, i highly recommend sharing a scoop of whatever ice cream they have night-of; they get all kinds of creative making up frozen happiness!

this is definitely a new favorite drinking spot.
author: michelle b.

description:
There isn't a sign, so either memorize the address, or look for an industrial loft, packed even on a Monday, where the cocktail glasses are too fancy for the building.
Having browsed the menu and steeled ourselves for a night of deep-fried meat, we ordered most things to share:
The Pickle Plate: was really diverse, and not too sour, ranging from spicy, to curried cauliflower, to caraway cabbage.
The Kale Salad could hardly count as our evening's vegetable (if cooked down it would have been Kale Gratin) but creamy mild dressing, tons of snowy parmesan, and rich pepitas made it meal-worthy.
I've waited too long to try a Scotch Egg and this one, surrounded by Brandade instead of ground meat, will have me trying more.  Despite having 4 condiments, they all worked together, or separately as I toured my plate.
The Manimal Style Thrice-Cooked Fries had me worried with their pallid color, but they were crunchy on the outside, creamy on the inside, and of course, covered in nouveau Thousand Island and some sort of dark and mysterious stand in for caramelized onions that I thought were seaweed, and my boyfriend thought were, well, caramelized green onions.  I concede that he's probably right.  Despite losing that bet (anyone feel free to back me up) this was the best thing I ate that night...and the week before.
The Shrimp Cocktail was a bit scant--4 shrimp in a wee dish with a spoonful of horseradish and a spoonful of their smoothly ketchup-like bloody mary mix.  While not for lovers of chunky, iced, old school Shrimp Cocktail, this dish is for lovers of raw shrimp--sweet, mild and tender.
I would never have ordered the rice plate, but for chicken-lovers and traditionalists, this little dinner of a deep fried rice block and tender chicken thighs is for you.
Last was the Trick Dog.  If you want an amazing, artery-clogging burger and fries, come to Trick Dog and get a Trick Dog and Thrice-Cooked Fries. While it is it's own tomato-less (and virtually lettuce-less) beast of high percentage meats, cheese and creamy sauce, when combined with the perfect fries, this could be the best burger dinner in town.  Just add a cocktail.
The cocktails veered a little farther from their ancestors...and were a little less palatable.  All pretty and creative, each tended to be overwhelmed by a token flavor.  The Mr. Big Stuff tasted like sunscreen (coconut).  The Evil Woman had the dark spice of dried chiles, and little else.  The Ain't No Sunshine was overpowered by the coffee liquor, there was one that tasted like burning rubber (mezcal), and there was even one that just tasted like lemon juice.*
I'm not a whiskey drinker, but the Bankrobber was my favorite of the night. Rounded, warm, sweet: it's token flavor would have to be the spirit of Christmases yet to come.

*I'm a sip mooch. I didn't actually finish all of these.
author: Laura S.

description: There is no sign? (I know it's supposed to be hip and I'm sure they did it on purpose but when you don't care about that nonsense it's just annoying when you're trying to find the place). It takes a long while to get a drink and there are just way too many fedoras and sunglasses for a dark indoor space. Apparently the place is known for their craft drinks and they were all good and all but it takes about 5 minutes for each drink to be made. Their beer selection is a little scarce and there is a severe lack of space to rest your drink. I just think I'm not old enough or too young (in that middle range where you can't handle trying to be cool) to enjoy this place for what it is, something over stylized and kitsch that'll be the popular place to go for the year.
author: Dominic C.

description: We had the "dealers choice" -- beautiful cocktails from a beautiful, sassy Mixologist.  Visiting from the Midwest and staying in the mission, this was just what I needed for a late afternoon cocktail.  Fresh, herbal, citrus perfection.  When the guy behind me ordered the "champagne of beers" (Miller High Life!), i knew i was home.
author: Sarah H.

description: Great vibe and innovative cocktails. Walks the fine line between douchebag trendy and a place I want to come back to. Had a couple of great cocktails, the 4 and the 5 ( don't ask for the name!) and the manly fries. Once again, found the balance between trendy and just good food. Perfect place on a warm spring night.
author: Steven B.

description:
Trick Dog is the perfect place to grab a drink with friends and catch up on your week, plus the bartenders know how to pour an amazing drink.  I've been there a few times now and while I've always raved about the Pantone, one of their best cocktails, tonight I tried the large format bottled drink called Buttermilk Punch and was blown away!  

The name would make you think this is some creamy concoction, but in reality it is a gentle, smooth bourbon cocktail that will leave you yearning for more.  The subtle flavors of the bourbon, buttermilk, marshmallow root, earl grey tea, and lemon are an amazing compliment to each other.  Definitely give this drink a try next time you're there...$35 for a bottle of this drink will easily pour 4-5 cocktails so it's a great bargain.
author: R S.

description: Do not come here!  You'll just be in the way of my friends and me.  We love this place.  Anyone that doesn't appreciate the creative cocktails simply isn't an adventurous drinker.  We came on a Friday night, it was jammed.  Do not let the crowds intimidate you.  Relax and simply make your way through.  We put our name in for dinner upstairs and made our way to the bar.  The drinks were awesome!  In 15 minutes we were texted that our table was ready.  The dinner menu is short but creative.  The Trick Dog was an amazing burger, as were the awesome fries that accompanied it.  Others had chicken nuggets, pork tacos, and skirt steak. All were awesome.  After dinner we went back downstairs for several more drinks.  A great night at a great place.
author: Vincent P.

description: Been there twice to eat dinner so sat in the cozy room upstairs - very nice ambiance.  Ordered the trick dog and the Kale salad - a little wary about each one. They both were superb.  Cool place, novel ideas, great drinks and nice staff.
author: Kathy G.

description:
***TIP: Chartreuse with a sparkling wine back. yum.***

Artisanal mixology and some really good food in a funky, Mission-y atmosphere. Looking forward to another trip!

Rating Scale:
1 Star: Avoid the town in which this place is located just to be safe.  
2 Star: With so many great places to choose from, why risk this one?
3 Star: I'll try it again or consume here in a pinch.
4 Star: I go here regularly if financially and/or calorically feasible.
5 Star: I look forward to taking my wife or friends here.
author: Michael T.

description:
ehhh..

like R.Kelly at recess, I had a ton of mixed feelings about this spot. rolled out for a friends birthday, we all got supadupa faded. the line was slow, but the inside is tiny! we rolled deep so parts of the group had to grab a table upstairs.

they have real cocktails that take a while, beet juice, curry powder, honey.. those types of ingredients added.. FEEL ME?

too many dudes, it was like a high school locker room..  a lot of cheap, musty cologne and terrible tattoos!

quite an experience, wouldn't kill me if i didn't come back!
author: Braden K.

description: Flipping through the ridiculously creative "paint" book menu was a preview of good things to come.  If I sat in a field and let my thoughts run wild, I don't think I would have come up with such an inventive menu.  It totally set the tone.  My "Vintage Photo" drink clearly looked difficult to mix.  While the alcohol kind of hit my palate hard at first, I began to savor the multiple layers to the drink as it lingered on my tongue.  It was a thought provoking moment.
author: Jeff J.

description: Trick Dog has fantastic cocktails (on a fun, paint-swatch like menu). The food is good for snacking on, as bar food goes, but I think they do a better job with drinks. The service was friendly and attentive, especially the bartenders.
author: Brett B.

description: Haven't eaten but have drank here and love it.  It's a bit fancy and all but the drinks are GOOD!  Wanna hit it up a few more times and grab some eats since folks seemed to be enjoying them.  Go for whatever drink sounds the most bizarre!  This is the kind of place to do it - and it'll be good!
author: Gene X.

description: Love this bar. Great cocktail list, last night we had the Razzle Dazzle and St. Elmo's Fire. Indulge in some fried delicious goodness and try the cracklins.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Get The Fish Tacos at the Bar and a Nectar Pale Ale.

The bartenders are great.
author: Daniqua J.

description: Love the drinks, off the hook! The people I try to do my best not to dislike them, but guys you are making me work really hard at it.
author: Irina T.

description: The drinks are incredible and unique.  Trick Dog moves away from the bitter/heavy drinks found at other popular establishments and towards the sweeter, mellower variety, but they do it well.  Pennies from Heaven is my favorite here - it's complex and full of different flavors.  The punches are likewise delicious and go a long way.  The place is usually packed, but it's a fun crowd.
author: Selene W.

description: Headed out to Trick Dog on Saturday night after hearing so much about this place.  We were definitely not disappointed! The menu is assorted Pantone colors and your drink will more or less match this.  I asked for something with Tequila and was directed to try the Turtle (?) drink which was topped with a very frothy egg white and cinnamon latte like top.  I can't even tell you how delicious this is! Go and try it!  My friends also had two delicious and colorful concoctions.  One was a beet juice and rye combo and the other a razzle dazzle (vodka?) type thing - also amazing!  A little out of the way for us since we trekked down from Nob Hill, but we will most definitely be back soon.
author: Camille D.

description: Trick dog? More like bitch dog. Servers and hostess are extremely rude. Sucks for them cause we were six people planning on buying a LOT of food and drinks. They would not accommodate us and we had to basically light a flare gun to get service. Well, we went to Southern Pacific a few blocks away and got food and drinks all night. Like I said THEIR LOSS!
author: Jari B.

description: My boyfriend and I were walking down the street and heard a bunch of people talking behind this one door. We decided to check it out and to our pleasant surprise it was this amazing bar. We enjoyed ourselves immensely. The cocktails are phenomenal, the bartenders really know what they're doing. We have yet to try the food out but we will definitely be back to try this out. The only reason why it lacks 1 star is the lack of seating, which they could easily add a few stools, as well as a bouncer standing out front the second time we went making people wait even though the inside was not even full. I was a bit confused by that but am still going to go back.
author: Annette D.

description: Great drinks, interesting and tasty food, but a bit noisy. We shared some plates, the asparagus, the kale salad, some crunchy rice thing with beef (delicious!) and a cheese dip. Servings are generous and we each took some some leftovers.
author: Susan B.

description: Delicious cocktails and awesome food. Bartenders were fast and friendly. Food servers were a little snobby, so have a drink downstairs first.
author: Leila C.

description: great cocktail.  I loved "Aint no sunshine".
author: Tami Z.

description: Awesome food. Really really goooood! We ordered steak,  buck choi, and mu shu taco. The place is a bit hipster looking. Kitchen is slow though - came at 9:30pm and the place wasn't busy, but still waited a long time for the food to arrive. Over all good experience. Will be back again.
author: Cheyenne G.

description:
i went here on consecutive nights, friday night at around 6:30 and saturday at around 4:30. two different experiences. friday night we sat upstairs for a quick bite and drinks. the cocktails and food were all good, but the upper level has no ventilation at all and the decibel level was at nine M-80's. you will not want to linger up there. saturday was definitely more relaxing. we grabbed two stools at the bar and were able to have a conversation and enjoy their cocktails. the common denominators on both evenings were perfectly mixed drinks, friendly service and chill music.

this is a good spot for pre-dinner drinks and snacks (they open at 3pm) at the bar. a very nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Rob D.

description: Was there on a friday night and as you could expect, it was packed house with youngsters and the lively crowd. 80's influenced playlist combined with the delicious cocktails from the hands of master mixologists made the night and we had a great time. Since it's just a block away from flour+water and next door to the central kitchen, i had a sinking feeling that this one also belongs to the same owners. I'm gonna be back Trick Dog!
author: Beril Y.

description:
If you have a gluten allergy don't eat here. They will NOT serve the trick dog without a bun.   This is BS.  
Drinks are Great.  So are the bartenders and servers.
author: alma h.

description: The drinks were properly precious. The bartender aptly tattooed. The steak tartare was good. The scotch egg wasn't my thing (the salt cod btw the egg and the crust didn't suit me).  And absolutely packed by 6:05pm.
author: Julie B.

description: First visit was a 4 star experience. Food and drinks were good, through service was only decent. Second visit was horrible. We told them we were three but were waiting for one more person. They refused to sit use at a 4 person table, ok understandable if it gets busy. 4th person arrived and they wouldn't give use a bigger table so we squeezed her in. The first three people had already order more than one round of drinks and several plates. We ordered more food and drinks but the waiter rudely brought us our check and told us we had to leave! He said there was a waiting list and we couldn't finish our dinner. Never have I felt so insulted at a restaurant. As if we were herd of people they need to cycle through and they try to get you in and out as fast as possible. No care to create pleasant dinner for you, they just want your money. Never going back, I recommend you skip it. At most grab a drink at the bar, but stay away from the dinner service!
author: mariano w.

description: I "swang" by here last week after Farina..the crowd was mixed...not too crowded very friendly.  It takes a while for the drinks to be made, so take the chance to chat with the folks.  They were playing a bunch of random music 80's, 50's, 60's it was nice..I like random.  The bar food looked super good...I will come back just to get my munch on!
author: Poppy M.

description: One of the best bars in San Fran (and, according to many travel articles one of the best in the US).  But, you have to be prepared and of the right mind.  It's typically very crowded but don't let the crown upon entering deter you.  Get yourself up to the bar, peruse their current selection of custom drinks, and get ready to have something you've never had before...Craft and inventive cocktails at their best!  The bartenders are some of the best and friendliest, without that suspender/goatee/tattoos thing attitude. Hungry?  Treat yourself to a table upstairs; it's a small area and if it's full give the nice girl your name and phone number and you'll get a text while at the bar.  It turns over rather quickly.  The food here is great.  I don't get the appeal of the kale salad (just not my thing when eating out) but the signature Trick Dog is awesome and the fries are some of the best I've ever had.  I get to San Fran about 6 times a year and Trick Dog is always on the agenda.  Go, have fun, and disregard the whiney negative comments.
author: David P.

description: We found ourselves at Trick Dog one sunny afternoon while wandering around the Mission, and absent-mindedly ordered a few cocktails. They were all delicious. We sipped, conversed, and laughed for a while, then when the crowds arrived, we disappeared into the night.
author: Loubna M.

description: The baby turtle, the trick dog, & the burnt popcorn ice cream (If it's still around) are must haves!!! Best Cocktails and Food in San Francisco in my opinion.
author: Marie J.

description: I love having this bar in the neighborhood. Every time I go I meet someone new. I like the complicated drinks and the showmanship of the bar tenders. With such a small space if the place is full it's hard to carry on a conversation.
author: Marty W.

description: Trick Dog is loud, trendy and has great drinks. Great crowd that shifts from mid-to-late 30s to mid 20s over the course of a Friday night.  The dinner move is to share the kale salad as an appetizer, then dive into the head cheese tacos. Pair it with whichever terrific drink floats your boat!
author: Fraser H.

description: No signage, awesome atmosphere. Well crafted drinks for days. Get there early or you'll find a line. Food does not disappoint. Limited seating, small bites, but you can order and eat from anywhere (Kale salad surprisingly good). If there's a biggest ice cube award amongst the bars in SF, these guys win.
author: Eric W.

description:
Fabulous bar with very nice drinks. Very San Franciscan, both in terms of styling as well as the hipsterish crowd. Bartenders really know what they are doing, and I enjoyed watching them.

But seriously, I've had the best cocktail of my life here, just asking the bartender to make his favorite.
author: X O.

description: Hipster/yuppie place with the attitude to match. To be fair, they make great drinks and the food is delicious. The wait time at the bar is LONG... Still, we were having a good time, up until the "unfortunate incident"... Daytime on Sunday, 6 people in our group. We ordered a bunch of food and we each had our drink (after already finishing a couple before). We were downstairs, in the "open" area. The place was starting to get crowded. We had our space on the counter, where our group was hanging out. We stepped outside to smoke (bad habit!) and left our half-finished food and drinks. We returned to find it all gone, and they gave the space to another group. WTF?! Naturally, we complained. One guy said he'll go talk to someone. So we wait... And wait... Finally, I go up to one of the bartenders who looks like she might be "in charge". She gives me attitude, like she has no idea what I'm talking about. The guy who we originally spoke with happens to be passing by. I grab him, and he hesitantly confirms our story. She goes to talk to another bartender. They call over the waiter who cleaned our space. The three of them deliberate for a while. We are still waiting, feeling pretty stupid at this point. Finally, she returns and, acting like they are doing us a HUGE favor, says that they will replace our drinks. OK, great! Except, when they bring them, they're like 20% full... Their excuse: your drinks weren't full when we took them! REALLY?! You effed up, and now you are going to add insult to injury?! And we weren't even asking for our food back! I have NEVER been treated like that, anywhere! I don't care how "hip" your place is, that's called being rude! Had they apologized and brought us a full round on the house, like any decent place would have, we would've stayed and kept ordering. We weren't ready to leave yet. But, needless to say, we did. We quickly finished their "drinks" and closed our tabs. Each of us left ZERO tip. Some chose to write a few choice words on their bill. I will never go back here. That's too bad, because, like I said: great food and drinks - but with THAT attitude, they can keep 'em!
author: Alex G.

description: Excellent drinks on or off menu. Fun to watch the mixologists do their thing. Try it.
author: Hamila K.

description: Nice friendly environment, wasn't too crowded for a wed night but u would still have to speak loud to be heard. I ordered the Alcatraz drink and the duck egg. The drink was strong and the egg was good but nothing i was overly amazed at. Some drinks and dishes were out which was a - :( on their part bc there wasn't that many ppl upstair dining. In my opinion, nice place but wasn't as great as all the hype.
author: Mary V.

description: Drinks were really good, there is no way around that. My girlfriend and I ordered three different cocktails and they were all excellent. The bartender was kind of another story. He seemed really disinterested in us, was curt and came off as rude on more than one occassion. Put a pretty girl in front of him and he lit up though. Hm. Maybe we will go back and not sit at the bar?
author: Ivy M.

description:
Pros--nice atmosphere, GREAT drinks, courteous bouncer (he wore a cape and held a book as a prop...or, maybe he was actually reading it), VERY nice bartenders (or, should I say, Mixologists?) ...they actually acknowledge you in a timely manner--Service with a smile! =) The whole menu thing is a little bizarre and hard to read, but I appreciate the creativity behind it. It may not be as frustrating to people if it was at a lounge where you can really just sit down and enjoy the ambiance and the company of others.

Cons--Horrible customer service from the 2 male servers, especially the hipster with a pony tail and fake black rim glasses. He was extremely rude...we saw him physically pushing people out of the way and screamed something along the lines of "coming through" as he squeezed his way through. My friend was taking a picture of me + my pineapple drink (it's the one inside a pineapple cup!) and he walked right through it and mumbled something...probably something rude. It's loud and crowded, we understand that. You are just doing your job. We know. But, if you hate your job, don't take it out on your customers. It was around 9:30pm on a Friday night and we just came from dinner. One of our friends (group of 6) came from playing Tennis and was starving. Server looked at us with disgust and said, "I'm not going to seat 5 of you if only 1 of you will be eating." That is absolutely fine and totally understandable, but he could have put it in a nicer tone. Maybe try, "Unfortunately, due to the limited amount of space, we only seat parties for full dinner". 

There are a lot of bars in the neighborhood and customer service really makes or breaks it for most San Franciscans. We have options and choices, why would we want to settle?
author: Michelle C.

description: Cool & original concept. Two stories where the bar is located on the first floor where they offer their full food menu and the dining area on the second floor. Located near a lot of warehouses on a poorly lit street so just look for the building with a bouncer in front.
