Drinks are well thought out - tried the "Grandma's Sweater" which was a perfect mixture of sweet + tart, however shared a carafe of their punch with my friend and was waaay too sweet, wish they had let me try it beforehand! Between my friend and I we tried the Trick Dog, the Scotch Egg, and a pickle board. I would recommend getting the pickles to munch on throughout the night as it is a decent portion. The Trick Dog is basically a hot dog-shaped burger. SO DELICIOUS. I wouldn't recommend sharing this unless you are prepared to fight for the last bite. Overall, the service was very attentive, the food was satisfying and the drinks were A-OK. I'll definitely be back to give some other cocktails a try.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Amazingly imaginative drink menu that changes every 6 months.  Great music. Very cool industrial kitschy decor.  Bartenders are bitchen!!  You HAVE to know where it is, since its not marked from outside, but when you find it, you will NOT be disappointed .
author: Kim L.

description: The type of bar we only dream about in Boston. Was extremely well treated by the barkeeps as we walked in as obvious tourists of a certain age on a Thursday night -- recommended to go their by a local sommelier we knew -- promptly got the "tourist map" of cocktails -- not offensive but perfectly done and appreciated in the moment, kudos to the person who crafted that -- and got great recommendations. As I hinted, we were obviously outliers in a wicked local crowd, but all good and won't be outsiders next visit, trust me. Bartender even gave great recommendation on what whiskey bar we should hop to next, as one in our party (me) had a craving. Good, on ya, Trick Dog, a must stop for us next time -- and we'll definitely blend better and stay for more than one. A+++
author: Jack D.

description: This bar made the worst Dirty Martini I have ever experienced. Combine that with the pretentious hipsters and this was easily one of my least favorite spots in SF.
author: Whitney C.

description: Meh. For $100, I had a mediocre at best meal and a below average dining experience. We ordered 5 cocktails, guac, beef tartare, and fish tacos. The food didn't thrill me. The cocktails we're delicious. I'd probably skip ordering food here---it's just not worth it for the price. The service was far below average. At first I was very excited because they let us squeeze 3 people into a 2-top. But that was BY FAR the highlight of the service experience. The rest of the night we were ignored. Our food came before our drinks. Then the waiter was very accusatory when we asked if our drinks were coming soon. Then the couple next to us bumped into our table and spilled water all over me and my beef tartare. The waiter did re-order the beef tartare but he should have comp'd it. Especially after we just asked him to pack it up because it took SO LONG. I would not recommend this place for food, dinner dates, or overall dining experiences. The cocktails were excellent though so I would recommend for that.
author: Sarah D.

description:
I ordered a double burger, and the waitress told me that the chef was 'kind of a dick' and therefore wouldn't serve such a thing. After some discussion, she really got into what a dick he was in detail. A simple 'no' in the first place would have been enough. Although I suppose it is kind of morbidly interesting to know that either the staff doesn't get along with each other or the guy preparing the food has a major chip on his shoulder to such a point that the wait staff feels the need to report it to anyone that will listen to them vent about it.
Or something. 
The food was okay I guess, but the burgers are pretty small for 10 dollars. I feel like serving a hamburger in a white-bread hot dog bun is a thin gimmick to avoid giving you very much meat or higher quality break, but maybe it is that white-trash chic comfort thing. Either way, be ready for a supermarket hotdog bun being a major part of your meal.
And remember, according to the wait-staff, the guy who works in the kitchen and is preparing your food is really a major dick.
author: Matt B.

description: really cool space and delicious drinks!  i was unfortunately only able to stay for a drink but i can't wait to come back for more!  the music is quite loud tho, so you will definitely be shouting in order to talk to your friends!
author: Helen T.

description: Went here for dinner on 4th of July when it wasn't busy (which I understand to be rare). The Kale salad was AMAZING!! I would go back for the kale salad alone. Fish tacos were also delicious. Only change I'd like is for them to take reservations :).
author: Claire T.

description:
This is the "In" place to be right now in the Mission, I had to go for myself to see what all the hype is about.  
The design is simple /industrial which seems so popular around here, Edison bulbs, concrete, exposed Ibeams etc. it's pretty dark, but it's a bar...  
The drinks are special and tasty, but pretty expensive  thus the $$$, but this is the Mission not the Marina.....
The "Mixologist" spends an unnecessary and unreasonable amount of time on each drink, I mean he's cute and all and can do tricks like shake 2 shakers at once  Wow!!! I just want a drink though!! Which takes forever to get here, we walked out after a 15 min wait and no one even asked what we wanted or acknowledged us  and we were standing right next to the bar the whole time.  Went back in, and found a waiter to help get us a drink, still waited another 15 min. Got a table to try a few of the food items, and again the service was horrible. It took forever to get anything!  The scotch eggs were interesting, nothing else really stood out though, the deep fried sweet breads were over fried and overbreaded. 
Probably wont be going back here, $12 for a small drink that takes almost a half hour to get is just not worth it to me.

Service sucks here bottom line
author: Molly M.

description: Unbelievably cool bar.  Went on a Saturday night with my husband and we both loved this bar.  Not that busy around 9pm.  We ate dinner earlier so we only had drinks but plan to go back for food.  I had a boiler maker with hard cider and Benedictine...and damn it was good.  Also had a highball with Anniversario rum and a Tamarind soda..delicious.  I didn't recognize at least 75 % of the alcohol product so I had many questions and both bartenders ( both chicks by the way...some people like that including myself) were happy to educate me and a couple of times let me sample.  Tip them accordingly please.  The young man at the door was great too.  It was his second day on the job and seemed right at home.  Everyone was really nice.  The drink menu is really creative but hard to read in the dim light, use your cell phone flashlight to read it.  The atmosphere is smooth and relaxing.  Great place for a date cause its romantic, and their creativity promotes conversation.  Plus great background music.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Jean C.

description: My wife and i asked our hotel for a great recommendation to get a drink and this was it. Great vibe, good drinks, awesome staff.
author: Dustin W.

description: grandma's sweater + beef tartar. absolutely delicious. It's a small local bar, a little cramped for comfort but what bar isn't.
author: Kim P.

description: It's a tiny bar with an upstairs area for dining, but really fun and different. The food is delicious too. The drink menu is unique and has interesting options, for example the drink I ordered called the "Leo"  had condensed milk mixed with other random ingredients, so I was being brave by trying it, but was pleased with the drink and thought it was quite tasty. I love the atmosphere here and the bartenders are very welcoming. I'll come back.
author: Yalda M.

description: Great cocktails, but a bit too loud for a Wednesday night.  Would be good for early pre-dinner drinks, before it gets too noisy.
author: M B.

description: I live two blocks from Trick Dog but never made it in until last night.. (mainly b/c there is often a line & was also under the impression that it was too hipster of a place -- I was wrong). I'm so happy i finally made it in because it is a friendly warm gathering place that far exceeded my expectations in ambiance, drinks and food. Love the baby turtle drink, as well as  the gypsy tan. I had 3 friends visiting from New Haven, Connecticut, so we chanced it & had dinner as well. My friends all said that it was the best meal they had in an entire year. They raved about the cracklins pork belly dish (I did not try it since i'm vegetarian). The kale salad was absolutely delicious. They also loved the Scottish egg. Can't go wrong w/ fried green tomatoes now, can you? The best part of the evening was our server Aaron. He was personable, intelligent and funny. Loved his stories about living in Louisiana. My experience at Trick Dog made me want to move in & never leave.. I hope this place does not become even more discovered than it is (open just a few months & already a mention in the NY Times, all SF papers, etc), because, as is, it is perfect. The creators of this place have done a stellar job in presentation & staffing.
author: Lynn m.

description: great drinks but too crowded! came on a thursday night and forgot it was a skool nite cuz there were so many folks. waited at bar for like 20 minutes and got grammas sweater. very good.  people seemed to love the sidecar too. bartenders seem to know what they are doing. and semi-friendly too. prolly would like the bar more on a day when i have more patience. :/
author: Van M.

description: This place rocks-- definitely one of the most fun new SF spots. Go late for the uber creative cocktails. Cool, vintagey decor.
author: Jo D.

description: I'm glad there are more New York style cocktail bars popping up in the city.  The bartenders are knowledgable and they serve tasty and pleasantly priced food late which I appreciate.  Whether you just want a quality shot and a beer for a well made cocktail this is a great bar.
author: Colin G.

description:
they have a scotch egg on the menu. my husband is english, and while this isn't the first time we've run across scotch eggs around here, it's still a pretty exciting discovery!

...except it's soft-boiled.  this, i gather, is a bit like finding out that someone's put bleu cheese creme inside the twinkie you're just about to eat, or you bought a slim jim and discovered as you bit into it that it's actually grape soda flavored - ultimately maybe that shit's tasty but dude! wrong!

anyway this menu discovery sparked spirited debate amongst my husband and his pals. discussion of northern vs. southern scotch egg styles and concepts like nonciness were thrown around, but ultimately an uneasy consensus was reached in slight favor of soft-boiled scotch eggs, since, after all, the folks running trick dog can choose to push boundaries however they like. 

five stars because we didn't actually order the scotch egg or discover the soft-boiled aspect of it until we reviewed the menu online later. had he ordered it and had it come as a nasty shock to british sensibilities, who knows what our rating would've been.
author: m l.

description: Drinks are definitely different in a good way. Make your way around the color wheel in a vibrant and comfortable local atmosphere. I'm sold on the drinks, need to find up if the kitchen is at the same level.
author: Irwin K.

description: great venue and great idea which earns all three stars...brings in too much of the kitchy hipster crowd that just tries too too hard...painful to watch one geek after another try to out hip each other
author: P C.

description: Awesome, all around. Really friendly staff, very well-balanced creative cocktails (I make cocktails for a living) and don't overlook the food. The trick dog is the best burger I've had in a long time, and the fried green tomatoes were perfect. Good job Trick Dog. I'll be back.
author: jeff w.

description: Excellent cocktails. Small and gets very busy. Tables upstairs are for those who order food. Get early and get one of those. The beer nuts were amazing.
author: Thomas K.

description: We went here on a Wednesday night at about 9 PM, got a couple stools at the bar, and ordered a couple drinks off of the clever menu.  They were delicious!  Even my highly discriminating whiskey swilling companion was impressed.  Glad there is a good cocktail place in this neighborhood.  Haven't tried the food, but I want to!
author: Kelly H.

description: Between 3 and 4 stars, depending on what you value more.  The atmosphere was good and the overall bar experience was fun.  That's the 4 star side of things.  The food and drink was the 3 star.  3 star doesn't mean bad - it just means it was not as good as other places nearby and I wouldn't go back specifically for that.  The trick dog was okay, but not as good as the slider we'd had at Asiento about 30 minutes before.  The beef tartare he liked, but I didn't because it was so heavily herbed/spiced that I could barely even tell there was beef in there - the herbs were overwhelming the flavor.  First time I've ever not eaten all of my share of a beef tartare.  Scotch egg was interesting.  Tasted fine, but didn't really seem to go together all that well.  I'm glad I tried it once, but I don't need to have it again.  Drinks were fine.  Creative, but not always as well-balanced as you might expect.
author: L C.
